Because it's not on the Steam page (as far as I can tell), this game contains many AI generated textures and assets. Maybe these got removed in the months I've stopped playing this live service game I pre-ordered but it's important to know this was ever a part of the process at all even if it gets reverted. The fact that at any stage of the map design process, AI is used, is a very bad indicator of the overall quality of the release product that you have to PAY MONEY FOR. Not a single good original map in this game and some of the maps they've taken from other games, they've only made worse. Check out the obviously AI generated city maps on the Houston Breakout heist that they released alongside a UI update that basically only meaningfully added a city map like in Payday 2. 

This game sucks. Don't buy it. Go play Payday 1 if you want some quality Christmas friendslop. As a huge Payday fan I'm mad this series was important enough to me to have wasted the first thing I bought my first paycheck being Payday 3: Gold Edition. That's the most interesting heist I can think of related to this game. Of all of the worst live service games in the past couple years this has been the most pathetic. I knew the soul was gone when they replaced Eric Etebari, Dallas' PD2 actor, a guy who vocally loved and was very passionate about his role as Dallas, promoted the game during development, interacted with fans a ton, whose face is literally like the first thing you saw in Payday 2. If you think it was bad when Hideo Kojima did that to David Hayter with MGSV you really have to recognize that this was such a shitty thing to do to such a publicly visible employee, and that it's even worse behind closed doors. Don't support this game. 

This series is hitting Fallout: Brotherhood Of Steel levels of "this dying company is clinging onto their cash cow and it's milk has dried out." RIP PAYDAY FRANCHISE 2011-2026, the way they throw around the Payday IP now for these one-sided collabs is just making them look desperate. Which they are. But know when Starbreeze faces bankruptcy and has to sell the IP it's not going to Ubisoft, it's not going to Microsoft, it's not going to FUCKING GEARBOX... It's going to sell to Running With Scissors. 10C probably won't be interested. They probably know not to sell it to Bo Andersson. Starbreeze's habit of being slavjank wearing a fake Gucci belt pretending to be way richer than they actually are has FINALLY caught up to them. They're going to come out with a new AI assistant called ShadeGPT to replace the FBI Files, to be announced in 2 months and added to the game heavily stripped down from what was announced after 8, with a future update said to release very soon then quietly cancelled a year later despite being "near completion" for months at a time. The cancellation of an offline mode is basically Starbreeze grabbing you, the person paying for the experience of riding Payday 3 Airlines, and jumping out of the plane hoping you can knit a parachute out of what cash is in your wallet so that you both can land safely. Some people might be more willing to knit that parachute. They're obviously bluffing based on the fact they already deployed it for a second then shoved it back in and awkwardly lied that it doesn't have a backup chute ready. Just let it die and play PD:TH 4EVER!

Don't get me wrong the game is fun, but I was under the impression that an offline mode was being actively worked on, and to hear that they just outright canned it for some silly reason makes me not even want to play it anymore. This game has an expiration date. When they don't feel like paying for servers anymore it'll just be gone. So much potential here being wasted.

This was the only game I ever preordered because of how much I loved Payday 2. I figured "Hey, they had over a decade of mistakes, lessons, and failed projects to build off of, surely they know what they're doing by now." Yeah, that sentiment aged well.

The game we ended up with at launch was a horrible, quarter baked, miserable excuse for a sequel. At this point in the game's life, it has only just gotten around to fixing up the horrendous launch state of the skill system. The weapons themselves are still underwhelming and fail to show useful stats, not to mention the mediocre feel of their attachments. Enemy AI is still braindead and somehow feel worse than they used to at launch. The technical side of the game is an absolute mess, with some day 1 issues such as civilians clipping through floors and the unreasonably unstable servers still being just as bad as they were 2 years ago. DLCs are still costly and there's little content aside from quarterly releases, leaving the game in extended droughts. Not to mention the AI slop they've dropped on social media, they seem to be doing the best they can to ruin the game as much as possible.

They're trying to get away with this holding pattern where they keep steadily adding to and improving the game, despite doing so at a glacial pace, because they believe their audience is stupid and will eventually forgive them for wasting over 2 years of their time. Don't fall for it. It looks like the game has come a long way from launch, and I guess technically it has, but that's only because the launch state of the game was practically a glorified tech demo.
The game feels too much like a Call of Duty mission, instead of giving you the freedom that Payday 2 had.

I think Payday 3 is fun. I think it has improved quite a lot since launch. However, I cannot, in good conscience, give this game a recommendation.

I have been patient with this game. I've played it despite its flaws, despite being a clearly inferior game to both its predecessors. I've waited through all the controversies for the game to get better. And it has gotten better: we've had Armor 2.0 which actually made armor interesting to use, and we've also had Skills 2.0, which removed the asinine Edge/Grit/Rush system and completely revamped a lot of the skills in a way that made the game much more fun to play... in loud in particular. Yeah, sorry stealth players...

But every time Payday 3 updates, I feel like the monkey paw curls one of its fingers. A big update happened? We're also cancelling offline mode! New heist? By the way, Almir Listo, the most recognizable face of Payday himself, leaves the company! Skills 2.0 update came out? Here, buy our plushie and look at our AI slop! Also, that's the only content you're getting for the rest of the year. Merry flocking Christmas heisters!

And those are just a few of the ones that I remembered off the top of my head. It just doesn't stop. This game is cursed to take a step in the right direction, only to jump right into traffic and get hit by a truck. The Advent Calendar event is the straw that broke the camels back for me that made me write this review. How do you make a 25-day event with content for every day, and deliver just one update of in-game content? The amount of teasers we were getting kind of led me to think we might actually get a heist. And my expectations were as low as low can be by this point. When the event began, I thought we'll get the Skills 2.0 update and a gun; not even a heist. [i]We didn't even get that.[/i]

And this is a relatively small gripe, but why is Teddy Moo so damn forced all of a sudden? In the almost 15 year history of this franchise, Teddy Moo made his debut in No Mercy in PD:TH, he re-emerged in the remake of No Mercy for PD2, then he got a mask in PD2 and an outfit in PD3. That's four times he's even mentioned in the franchise, and only two of which where he's actually played a role in a heist (both of which are the same heist in different games, mind you), in almost 15 years! And now you're expecting everyone to just accept him as the new mascot of the Payday franchise? Get out of here with that contrived nonsense! Let me give you four words that you could work with to use as mascots: "Dallas," "Hoxton," "Wolf," and "Chains." The original four heisters, the ones who's faces are all over this entire franchise, aren't good enough anymore?

So, no. I cannot recommend this game. Not until Starbreeze and OVK get it together and actually focus on making the game better and not showing half-hearted efforts to appeal to your fans in trying to keep the franchise alive by any means necessary. The 180 they have to pull on this game has to be on the level of Cyberpunk 2077 or No Man's Sky, but I really don't see that happening.

I'm otherwise a relatively patient person. I've been waiting for a sequel to something I love for well over a decade now, and I thought I could wait until Payday 3 could get to the point where I can happily recommend it to my friends. Unfortunately, this game has stretched my patience so thin that I don't think that day will ever come. So all I can do, at this point, is to keep following this game until the inevitable death knell rings.

... At least we still have Payday 2.

As a massively obsessed fan of PD:TH and PD2, PD3 is an absolute disappointment compared to its predecessors even after 2 years of its release. Game lacks so much content in every department, many features that made PD2 as fun as it is replayable are missing such as perk decks, and the overall experience was just a massive "Meh". 

Here were the things that PD3 improved from PD2:

-Visuals are obviously a massive improvement. Texture details are actually detailed. Environments feel more vibrant and life-like, and textures don't look like MS Paint generated geometrics anymore. 

-Gunplay feels so nice and punchy. I feel the weight and "oomph" of shooting, and the sound design and animations of the gunplay are definitely satisfactory. The way guns feel here actually feels similar to Battlefield 6 for me, for some reason.

-Movement is a lot more fluid and responsive. I feel fast when I sprint, and I go wherever I input myself to go. No issues on movement. Also, instead of spamming sprint+jump+crouch in PD2, they added sliding, which is neat.

-Interaction animations are cool. Every specific interaction depending on the object or task has their own specific animation, which I thoroughly enjoyed. It isn't that static no-hands display on every interaction like PD2 anymore.

-Overkill weapons are a nice touch.

-Stealth is SO MUCH BETTER. You can finally interact and do what you need to do without the need to mask in. Guards feel more natural, and they don't phase through solid walls anymore or see you through 2 layers of concrete to detect you. Also, being able to answer the pager while carrying the body? I love it.

-The game does feel more "high-octane" than PD2, which I do enjoy and expected for PD3. It feels more adrenaline-inducing, and I do still get that iconic rush of a Payday game.

-Haven't encountered any bugs so far, so I assume most the bugs on release were already addressed by now.

Here are the things PD3 has downgraded from PD2:

-Obviously, content. Ever 2 years later from release, there is still an absolute content drought. Fewer heists than PD2 even on that game's release. There are way too few guns to play with, and even with the new Skill Tree 2.0 update, the skill trees still feel bare and minimum to me. The sandbox mayhem you could enjoy from PD2 is missing in PD3. Also, no perk decks. What the fuck?

-Heists feel way too short. I noticed that in a span of one hour, I was able to finish 5 heists. That's roughly 12 minutes only per heist. Compared to PD2, where a heist can take as long as 45 minutes, even one day heists. Speaking of, please bring back multi-day heists.

-Heists weren't memorable at all. A number of PD2 heists actually had weight to them, and some of them stuck to me to this day, such as Hoxton breakout, Hotline Miami, Birth of Sky, Shadow Raid, and many more. In PD3, I play through a heist, and I don't feel much anything afterwards. I just felt the heists were mostly just a get-in, smash some things and take loot, and escape. Them being short as well added to their blandness. They just didn't feel good.

-Heist mechanics are okay. Still has the usual do this and do that to open this and access that type of flow. I say downgrade in the sense that there isn't any improvement from PD2. However, the heists mostly lack on the random nature that PD2 heists have especially on things like objective item spawns, making the replayability of each heist in PD3 just boring and static. I'm just doing and expecting the same thing over and over again.

-Difficulty? Where's that? I don't know, I only reached level 29 but I'm already able to breeze through overkill difficulty even without a completed skill tree. The game definitely feels WAY TOO EASIER. I noticed that, atleast for me, in increasing difficulty, the only thing that also increases is just the number of spawns. Damage felt more or less the same across all difficulties. The game didn't feel challenging enough for me to enjoy. You know the posture where you start leaning forward in your seat and focus your eyes to the monitor and lock in? I never experienced it in my 4 hours at the time of writing this review, even playing on Overkill difficulty.

-Police AI feels stale. I don't know how to describe it exactly, but they just feel more bland and unengaging. I don't get that same feeling of being overwhelmed like in PD2. It's like they only just spawn, and move a bit and shoot, as if they only exist just for something for you to left click at. Even special enemies, especially bulldozers, feel underwhelming.

-No infamy or prestige system, which adds to it's already poor replayability.

-PD3 is slowly developing a DLC infestation like PD2. The new content in this game aren't being released as free updates, but as all DLC. The recent DLC, for example, is just a heist. And it's cost at full price is not justified at all. I hope starbreeze makes future content mostly free updates, with a only a bare minimum of paid DLCs here and there if they need to.

-Due to the aforementioned downgrades I noticed, as well as many other factors, PD3 has an abysmal player count even with crossplay on. On the server browser, I usually find like only 8-ish heist lobbies every refresh. Sure that's good enough to find lobbies, and I do still get players joining my lobby when I host. However, in some heists I just end up playing with the same people.

There definitely are many other more issues with the game, but these were just the things that really made the game worse for me.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I have played both PD:TH and PD2 for an unhealthy amount of hours, and they were the best CO-OP shooters I have ever played, with most of my hours sunk into PD2 despite it's poorly optimized, DLC infested, unbalanced content. Still, it was peak co-op heisting for me.

When the first trailer for Payday 3 was dropped, being hyped was an absolute understatement. I couldn't wait to get my hands on Payday 3 and see what Starbreeze has added to the heisting scene, seeing as how successful Payday 2 was. However, I have a personal rule that I usually wait 2 months after a game's release to see how well it performs, and usually 2 months is a good enough time to assess player retention after release. I was honestly fighting the biggest urge to purchase the game on release as I really just wanted to jump into the game immediately. Oh boy, was I right not to surrender myself to temptation.

In a nutshell, the game flopped HARD on release. The game got "Mostly Negative" reviews, and everyone, including my favorite PD content creators such as GeneralMcBadass, said the game was a buggy, content-deficient, lackluster experience. The first few months of the game was horrible, as what I've seen online.

I decided to let the game refine itself for a year before deciding to buy the game, as I had hoped by then that Starbreeze would have enough time to address all the issues. One year later, game still has shit reviews with mostly the same concerns such as poor content. So I gave it another year.

I mostly forgot about the game, and only remembered it this winter sale. Now the reviews improved, but it's only Mixed. From what I've heard, the recent update on skill trees was a step in the right direction, as well as people saying it's a lot better than release. So, seeing as it was 50% off anyways, I decided to grab it. Played 4 hours worth, and I did not thoroughly enjoy those 4 hours.

What happened, Starbreeze? PD3 had SO MUCH potential to be one of the greatest in the CO-OP genre. PD2's formula was a smash hit, so it came to no surprise that the expectations for PD3 were quite high. But by God, was this game an absolute underdelivery. I still have glimmers of hope that maybe you could turn this around, as I am among this franchise's most loyal and absolute fans. The games were my childhood, but even someone like me can't defend this slop.

For my first title in payday (yes I know its stupid I'm joining in 3 and not 2) its pretty good. The gunplay is nice along with the heists. The skill tree is pretty sucky but the stealth is fun. I'm looking forward to playing co-op with friends

I've tried so hard to enjoy this game but it's honestly impossible, I hoped with the armor and now skills 2.0 updates that it would be better but no such lucky. The game is now entirely too easy now even on overkill and the endless amount of bugs that make me regret even buying this.

Not sure whether to give a thumbs up or down. But I'll summarise what I think so far, I bought this game on sale in 2024 as I have played Payday 1 and 2 with friends before. In 2024 the game was still pretty bad and quite boring. Today as of December 2025. I can say the game is better, there are good DLCs for heists at least out, so some content is there, no where near as many as Payday 2 but that is understandable as that game is like over 10 years old.

What is most lacking is guns right now. Otherwise the gameplay is really addictive and fun, especially the stealth. The solo mode is also playable now, unlike in 2024 where is was extremely unbalanced.

So what is still bad? Well the game is a live service always online bullsh*t game. Unlike its two predecessors. Well why is this bad? This means if Starbreeze ever stops supporting this game, then its dead, especially if they shut the servers down, then you can't even access it anymore... There is no modding scene, so even the community can't add heists or other game modes or guns, and make the game more fun. So unlike Payday 1 and 2, this game actually has an expiration date.

For now I will give it a thumbs up, the game was bad before, but I will commend the devs for at least sticking with it and making it better. Just find away to get the game out of the servers and make it more moddable and it could be peak.

It's not bad when you get it for cheap on sale, however if you're expecting more of payday 2 ( which I'm personally more familiar with and I do prefer it to this game in most aspects ) you'd be disappointed. The game plays differently to it's predecessor. While I'd say payday 2 is more like a sandbox almost where you can mess around with different perk decks, weapons and skills to enhance said weapons and some other gameplay elements while also shooting a bunch of enemies with enough variety ( I will admit though that the lack of the medic unit in payday 3 is a good thing but the inclusion of new ones like the nader or techie has been done poorly ) and the game being overall chaotic ( and fun ), this game is taking things slower when it comes to action and limits the things you can mess around with. Overall I would recommend getting payday 2 over payday 3, especially during a sale where you can get a LOT of content in the second game for a fair price ( that cannot be said about payday 3 which lacks content that is worthwhile to this day).

OVERALL: I used to love playing Payday 2 every single day on my Xbox one. I've actually had a really fun time on this game. Sure, this game is not even close to Payday 2 but if this game is on sale and you're looking for something fun. I'm sure you'll have a good time on this game. The worst part about this game is the always online factor of this game. If this game stops getting support from these servers, there could be a high chance of this game going unplayable. I would give this game a 6.5/10.

To be honest this game isn't perfect by any means but I love it. The potential with this game is very high but I feel like the developers don't really see the problem and are trying to fix issues which aren't the main ones. I know the team has a lack of funding so I am a bigger supporter owning almost every DLC for the game. The new skill system is the first step in the right direction I have seen since the game came out. The next step for the developers is to make the game more arcade like and add cool but stupid features. Stuff like that is what makes Payday what it is. In payday 2 you could bring an explosive crossbow to a heist and dominate with it or you could use a giant spoon and kill cops with it. The point is the game is trying to be too "realistic." The new skill system really helps because it makes not one build the best but it is up to the player to decide what they want to do. I think they should also expand on the overkill weapons because I feel those have a lot of potential as well. The next best way to make the game more "arcade like" is to add stupid but good and funny weapons and playstyles.
Stealth doesnt feel fun anymore after they had to rework the Skill system, it just feels like they removed to many good features of the previous Skilltree

I’d recommend Payday 3 as a cure for boredom, assuming you’re comfortable trading it in for constant irritation as a side effect, due to its overall bland game design, mediocre and poorly executed heist ideas, imbalanced difficulty, and plainly dumb enemy behavior design.

Seriously, why did they ditch the traditional but effective Cloaker design? It went from quiet horror to a kamikaze, respawning annoyance with wallhacks.

Is a fun enough time to roll around in. Better if you have some friends, still works well without. Gunplay's solid and there's enough variety in guns and skill loadouts to play differently. Biggest weakness is the heist selection doesn't feel super strong. Hard to pin down why. With Payday 2's colossal heist pedigree its hard to be objective given how long that game had to mature. I'd pick up Payday 2 one way or another, if you play that game to death like I have Payday 3 may have some legs. As a standalone game, 3 is pretty good. It's just damn hard to live up to 2, but its getting there.

For one thing, the new skills update is a *massive* boon for the game. The former skill system was deeply flawed with well-intentioned choices to make the fluid line-system work with using the Edge, Grit, and Rush mechanic as a way to try to glue it together. While I think in a different world it could've worked well, having things like "Shoot 35 bullets" and "Swap your weapons" be methods to gain Edge, it had a deep micromanagement problem. This just wasn't fun to deal with and didn't achieve the goals they were going for with trying to push for certain playstyles enabling skills.

Now, it's the tried and true: Skill trees with a focus per branch and increasing point cost. No more dealing with getting buffs through odd actions, things either just work or work off of way more straightforward triggers. Much cleaner and simpler to setup a build and overall covering more gameplay options than before. The differing skill point costs also fixed most loadouts being a muddy mix of core overachieving skills plus some random junk thrown in there. Skill setups are much more focused now which defines playstyles a whole lot better.

Cobbling together loadouts was what attracted me to come back for a bit. Just wanted to throw out that I greatly appreciate this skill overhaul because *mother of god* did I hate the old system. Again, not a bad core concept, but what we've got now is so much better than before.

Even though it's a skeleton in comparison to PD2, those bones are much more refined. Far less jank, far less content; better gameplay, less variety. It's a mixed bag. My favorite parts are the armor rework and how shields can be countered with any weapon. 

I'd say it's worth the $30 and deserves more players than it has, but it needs a faster development cycle if it wants to stay relevant. It took them 2 years for the game to be a good recommendation.
It's ok. Very confusing for a new player. I'm not excited for any of the skill or equipment unlocks. Maybe it's more fun with friends online, but as it is, it's bland.

It's stunning how two years later, the game still feels like an Unreal asset flip that bought a ton of bootleg PD assets and called it a day. I have to resort to two year old mods to get this game to somewhat feel like payday.

1) Just get us back to P2P networking/local saves at this point. Get us PD2 Crime.net, gut the shitty systems you have and fuck off. Never would I have guessed a dedicated server implementation can be so cursed.

2) Go back and play the older games. QR codes, domination capture points, and all the tedious silly mini games need to be taken out back. Let key cards and stealth elements be hidden and very randomized. Not everything needs an outline or follow the same rigid stealth structure. and yes rework all the heists to have unique gameplay.

3) Start incorporating obvious QoL mods, restore PD2 elements like the font and some UI elements instead of the ones present that feel pulled out of an UE4 template.

4) All the VA is awful, Add more radio distortion, remove the cringe jokes/banter and straight up replace them with an interesting new set of characters.

Get your heads out of the sand, quit ignoring the obvious pain points and avoiding doing right by the game and the people who supported you for long term exploitation and monetization (guarantee you that you will never have a successful mtx store and you have lost so much money and interest from insisting on trying to police DLC unlockers and you wont get 75% of it back even if everything goes incredibly well from here on out) or its your jobs on the line. ⭐⭐⭐☆☆
**“Payday 3: Fun Heists, Slow Fixes”**

Payday 3 has some great ideas — the gunplay feels solid, the movement is smoother, and when a heist actually comes together, it feels amazing. The teamwork moments hit hard, and the style is definitely there.

But the game launched missing a lot of what made Payday 2 legendary, and even now it still feels like it’s catching up. Limited content, weird progression, and matchmaking issues drag down what could’ve been a top-tier co-op heist experience.

It’s fun *when everything works*, but it doesn’t always work.

**3/5 — shows potential, has its moments, but still feels like a work-in-progress robbery.**

It took a while, but they really pulled this game around on most fronts. Slowly, I've watched it become a worthier successor to its predecessor, Payday 2. Which let me clarify, is still the goat in comparison. But Payday 3 now offers a lot more than it did on its flop of a launch.

An array of skill changes, followed by the inevitable Armor and Skill 2.0, coupled with a multitude of weapon adjustments, balances, several much needed quality of life additions, and gameplay tweaks make this a whole different game. 

Its a lot of fun for a few heists whenever I have a minute, regardless of my style of heisting that day. Everything here feels well crafted, and finely tuned. Though, its come at the steep cost of quantity. 20 bite sized heists that pack a punch, but will leave you wishing there was more.

This moment, Payday 3 is a great albeit short, crime fueled romp for friends who want something cathartic, and don't mind the edgy virtual violence of shooting through a police station or even an New York State court house.

Alternatively though, it can be for the gamer who wants a fresh challenge for their brain, to be a ghost and stealthily rob the rich or corrupt from under their noses with a cool crew of likeminded heisters.

Its a lot of fun, and after several short breaks playing regularly since its utter tragedy of a release, I can say confidently that Payday 3 has massively improved, the develops slowly having crafted a version that pales in comparison to what we have now.

The lack of any offline mode in the event of an eventual server shutdown is still frustrating and a perpetual issue however, and is always a huge disclaimer I like to give for Payday 3. 

Until then, this games a hesitant recommendation to grab this fun project and do some crimes on discount. Which to the developers credit, seems to happen fairly often.

So I don't usually write reviews to game unless they really impress me or they disappoint me completely, sadly, this is one of the later cases so let me begin with my issues towards the game:

- I wasn't really waiting for this game to be honest, I was thinking from the beginning it's a bad idea to push out another game when payday never needed a "new game", it just needed some update to it's second game to keep it up to date visually and mechanically.

- I've played payday 2 for a very long time and it's been my favourite game and first game on steam, I made a steam account just for payday and since then even if they had some attempts at greedyness, I loved every second of it, bought every dlc individually, was there for all the new update, everything new added to the game, hearing about payday 3 made me think they are giving up on payday 2 entirely which they didn't because they added a monthly subscription to give all the dlcs while having the monthly subscription, so I guess fuck the hundreds of dollars I gave for dlcs cuz now everybody can have everything for just 9.99 euros a month... ofc after you buy the base game.

- I understand thet they wanted to make the game more "realistic" but they somehow managed to make it completely out of immersion, the arcadey payday 2 had me more immersed than this game ever had, I still come in every update thinking "even payday 2 had a bad start but they improved" but every update I'm trying to find reasons to not quit the game and sticking to payday 2 but I'm finding it almost impossible

- servers and network are a joke, why did they ever think even solo mode needs to find a server to host the game is beyond my understanding, feels like they got their server knowledge from ubisoft and they still somehow made it worse than them.

- I don't really have anything good to say about the game, it's mechanics are dreadful, it's gameplay is boring, the updates are exciting but then you get disappointed because the delivery is lackluster or doesn't feel like it improved on anything, I always liked starbreeze and tried finding a excuse for them but at this point, they had the whole community supporting them when they almost went bankrupt and then they still treat their costumers the way they do, I understand they need a source of income to pay people and resources, but at this point I'd rather have starbreeze focus on other projects and just admit payday franchise is just dead, they don't deserve your money or attention anymore, keep your money and spend it on something else.

I really don't know what to say about this game

- at launch day, the game is pretty much a solid game with a clear vision of what PD3 want to be but got ruined because of lack of contents and being in unplayable state (i know this is highly the cause of plaion want to rushed the launch day to gain profit but this really hurt the game future in the long run as we can see even after 2 years)

+ this systems was made by the people that play stealth on normal and failed multiple time on loud while they are trying to showcase skill 2.0 on stream said a lot, these people have 0 clues how to balance a game.
+ it so unpolished and rushed that nothing sync together like the whole thing is holding by duct tape.

I'll start by saying this is no Payday 2. But, that's okay. The game launched in a very rough state and still has some issues. However, the team behind Payday 3 has shown continued support to improve the core gameplay. Armor 2.0, Skills 2.0, and new heists that build on the gameplay loop continue to be released. Don't get me wrong, the game still has plenty of issues. There are only a handle full of masks and mask customization options, and there feels like a lack in variety of guns. Overall I think this game has the potential to be fantastic if given the opportunity.

I think the game is at a point where I would start recommending it to people, especially with the recent "Skills 2.0" update. And for context, I played the game when it first launched; bugs, issues and all.

The game has come a long way from it's launch with the addition of a couple things that I saw that I thought were notable. First was the ability to play in a "Solo" game. You no longer need to wait to connect to server, which massively improved load time. And when you have to restart a mission for any reason, there's no massive wait time like there was before. Which is a big plus for me.

I understand people are still upset about the fact that you need to be online in order to play the game at all, but that's not really a deal breaker for me.

Now with "Skills 2.0" update, the game feels a lot better. We're back to the old Payday 2 skill tree system, and I am here for it. Old builds from Payday 2 are now possible in the game. Not to the same extent as they were in Payday 2, but they are present. There's no longer a need to unlock individual skill sets, which makes customization a lot smoother and take less time. 


There are some things I think the game still needs to improve on, but I think so far that everything is moving in the right direction and is being set up for these changes.

Firstly, the loadout system needs reworked. I would love there to be a way I could go without armor entirely, that way I could get the most out of the certain skills. Additionally, it can be a bit confusing trying to find the weapons I want, so something I would like to see is some weapon organization or filter implemented. 

Secondly, the new skill system still needs some tweaks and work done to it before it can be called perfect, but it is a colossal step in the right direction. Certain skills need altered or buffed, while other skills can be reworked as other changes are implemented. 

But at the end of the day, I think the game is ready to come back into the light. It's now where it should be by no means, but it's making the necessary corrections to get there and I'm happy for it. I don't want to see this game die, and I want nothing more than to see it make a return No Man's Sky style. I think that would be spectacular.
it is a good game for about 5$ no more

"Nooo, they fixed that! Now you level normally!"
> Ohh, so just the game where armor is a finite and shit resource to manage then?
"Nope, we fixed that too with Armor 2.0 (finally!)"
> Really? Neat! So the guns don't feel so bad, the armor is decent, and this 'edge/grit/rush' system is...manageable, actually! Depending on how you approach it you can make a bunch of varied options and builds for specific situations...Maybe this isn't quite as bad as everyone said it was! and the unmasked/stealth/hostages aspect is a lot better than 2's!

[Fast Forward to December, 2025]

Hey, here's this new system that our survey says EVERYONE loves more than edge grit and rush!
> looks inside
> Every synergy or build concept (that Bias: I enjoyed) is now divided over 2-3 subsections, stuffed with a ton of filler combat perks for specific weapons/grenades, and that's it. 
> You need to be level 150 for the *51* perk points, basically half of which you spend to acquire *2*, arguably 3 actual perks that benefit stealth (pre-mask/pre-cop) gameplay, and the other half being nerfed hacker/  severely nerfed grifter (getting to that).
> Oh, did you enjoy having smoke grenades? That's the Ninja tree now. You'd think a Ninja would have throwing knives, but sorry, that's lumped in with Medic/Grifter. Want to pair engineering with a chunky rifle for killing Dozers? I hope you didn't want armor, or hacking with that, because you're already splitting between 2 if not 3 "classes". Oh, you *like* hostage taking? And the only grenade that helps with civy management is flashbangs? Well- do you like *ammo boxes?!* because that's the synergy with Hostage Taking! 
> Transporter, Adrenaline, Grifter, Thief, Marks, Takedowns, Quickdraw/Desperado pistol setups- ENTIRE trees are smashed down into 1 or 2 perks, usually far weaker than whatever they offered before. 

"But you have 51 skill points now, instead of 28 before!"

> I can, if I trim out every quality of life, recover 50-60% of the build(s) I enjoyed before, and almost none of what I can recover or keep pertains to pre-loud gameplay. And now the game expects me to let it control my loadout, because "Why would you ever want Shotgun perks as a hostage taker, or assault rifle perks with some medical fallback"
> Did you want to be able to move loot good for your crew? *20+* of your 51 points are spent on acquiring *just* the ability to carry 2 bags without penalty, and quickly jimmy/punch a lock. Yeah, you get some benefits to armor bags and thicker armor! ...and also dodge!....which wants you.. to have...less armor...

[h1] PAYDAY 3 takes a giant step away from its predecessor... and falls down the stairs, Peter Griffin style. [/h1]

Is the game fun to play when it works? Kinda. The game got better after the release with the introduction of reworked (PAYDAY 2-like) armor and skill systems. Stealth got more mechanically complicated with the introduction of different types of zones (Public, Private, and Secure), different types of civilians (normal Pedestrians and Employees), and the new Search phase that is now triggered first before the alarm (which throws out of the window all timings and paths of guards, so you have to be much more careful). And switching the difficulty feels more impactful than in the 2nd part, where playing on Mayhem is pretty much the same as on Death Sentence. 

Loud also feels very different. Shooting got some weight added to it, SWAT units actually try to hide behind Shields, Cloakers are like toddlers with knives running around, Bulldozers can be a problem when there are a lot of enemies around, and Tasers... well, they are also here. On top of that there are 2 more new special units (Grenadier that throws toxic grenades that damage your health directly, and Drone Controller that hides somewhere in a corner and keeps launching multiple kinds of drones), which is nice, but in general the Loud part of the game is quite easy. Even on higher difficulties with randoms you can escape with a stealth build once one of them triggers the lasers in a vent where they had absolutely nothing to do. 

But the rest of it, outside of the gameplay, is still broken and much worse than the second part. First of all, the game is online-only. Allegedly, to prevent players from cheating (you can check videos on YouTube to see how "well" that is working). Does it introduce problems? Of course it does!
- Creating a contract takes 30+ seconds.
- Restarting the contract doesn't change anything (same spawns of items, same codes, same everything), most likely because of the previous point. 
- If the server crashes (and it will) - the host will also get disconnected.
- If joining a lobby fails - sometimes it takes time to go back to the [noparse]Crime.net[/noparse], sometimes you have to "re-login".

And the UI isn't much better:
- In-lobby chat is somehow worse than in the 2nd part.
- There is no level filter for your lobbies. Low levels will frequently join Overkill Stealth just to start blasting guards (and playing solo is boring).
- As far as I can see, you cannot join random lobbies with the DLC heists you don't own. You can still see them in the [noparse]Crime.net[/noparse], but instead of the "Join" button, there is a banner that tells you to buy the DLC, which is just scummy in my opinion. You can disable specific heists in the filters... but they reset each time you open the menu, so that's useless.
- In the inventory, instead of pages of weapons or masks, we now have a scrollable list with 2 columns, which is incredibly annoying to use and shows only 8 items at once.
- Weapon upgrading also uses a horizontal scrollable list, that is way too wide.
- When buying a weapon - for some reason it shows you a list of all of them (both Primary and Secondary).
In general some of the menus feel like a mobile game menus that weren't properly ported to PC.

So while I'm mostly having fun with the game, I wouldn't recommend it to my friends. It took them 2 years to fix only some of the launch problems, and with their new CEO being some EA executive who uses GenAI, I don't really want to support them anymore.

I remember when PAYDAY 3 was revealed I was over the moon that I would finally be able to be there for the launch of a new game in my favorite series since I joined into PAYDAY 2 late, I made it into the closed beta and had tons of fun seeing what was new and just the general allure of a new heisting game.

Come release day and I remember it was plagued with tons of issues I cannot for the life of me remember but I know it was server issues and such and then realizing it was always online, I can't remember if it was stated before release or not but that was a huge blow knowing that if you are ever without internet you are just locked out of playing the game you bought.

Despite all the issues I still found myself having fun with the game even if I was growing bored of the lack of content and such. Fastforward to present day its still online only but there is more content and weapons to sink your teeth into and I find myself wanting to come back to this game everynow and again, does that mean its good? No. I'd say its okay for where it is now, theres a fair few heists and fun weapons to play with. At the time of writing this "Skills 2.0" was announced that will probably fix the issue of the skills feeling lackluster and feeling as though they do nothing.

All in all I'd say you can have fun with it but for now I'd suggest you pick it up on sale as I don't believe its worth full price.

After two years, my perception of PAYDAY 3 has changed.
I feel that the game is, at last, reaching a good place. Starbreeze has been working hard and if they continue with their intended cadence of updates, I fully believe the game has the potential to overshadow its predecessor.
The improvement in stealth gameplay compared to PAYDAY 2 deserves special mention: it was an abysmal leap in terms of depth and mechanics, making this approach to heists much more rewarding for me personally.
There are still challenges ahead, mainly regarding long term content and the endgame progression system, but the game's foundation is excellent and the direction is correct. 
For those who gave up at launch, this is the ideal time to return or try it out. I recommend it!

Payday 3 feels like slipping the old clown mask back on and remembering exactly why you started robbing banks in the first place—only now everything’s shinier, meaner, and just chaotic enough to make your palms sweat. The heists hit hard, the gunplay is crisp, and when a plan actually comes together you feel like a criminal mastermind… right up until the cops show up with enough firepower to level a small city.

Yeah, the game doesn’t have a ton of support right now, and it’s definitely been a rough ride at times. Matchmaking can get messy, and sometimes it feels like the game is allergic to letting you into a lobby. But once you’re in? Pure, beautiful mayhem. Lasers, loot bags, hostages screaming, alarms blaring—chef’s kiss.

Despite the rocky support, I’m still genuinely excited to see what they’ve got planned next. There’s a solid foundation here, and if they build on it even half as well as the chaos deserves, Payday 3 could end up being something wild.

PAYDAY 3 had a messy launch, but the game today is way better than what we started with. The guns feel punchy, the movement is smooth, and the heists look amazing. Stealth is actually enjoyable now, the AI is improving, and new content keeps coming in. When everything clicks — coordinated takedowns, tight timing, big payouts — it delivers that classic PAYDAY chaos in the best way.

It still needs more maps and polishing, but with friends it’s an absolute blast and finally feels like a proper follow-up to PAYDAY 2.

Work a second try. Definatly improved since I played the Beta

This isn't perfect but been having a good time with it playing with my mate. Still a learning curve with the new systems and mechanics, i imagine this not being an issue if you didn't sink hundreds of hours into PD2.

Personal Issues
 - Although I don't hate the new skill system, I don't like how almost everything ties into the EGDE, RUSH and GRIT mechanics. Most skills effectively act as buffs to these which is cool but they are on timers and some skills causes you to loose one of them as soon as you do something like vaulting. Meaning a lot of the time you're running without skills until you get one of these temp buffs. This means I'm building to maximumise the amount of time I have these buffs rather than crafting a playstyle (I have just seen that the Skills 2.0 update is coming soonish getting rid of this complaint but until I can play with it myself i will keep this point here. new update does look good though)
 - UI and Loadouts have seen an improvement but the weapon store specifically is a problem, Standard weapons are burried underneath DLC you may not own and premade weapons you can't customise (why would I want them if I can customise standard weapons I buy)
Also for some reason primary and secondary weapons are mixed together, instead of seperated into their own cateagory, just makes the weapon store look like a confusing mess
 - They seem to have added extra steps to every interaction, imagine doing something in PD2 now add extra steps. For example I dropped a USB into a computer and expected it to just go so I went straight to moving bags. What you need to do is put in the USB, start the transfer, wait, then complete it. each requiring you to hold to interact each step.
Same with drills, place drill. bolt it in (sometimes) wait, remove the drill, then open the door, again each step requiring your to hold interact, its unnecessary 
 - armour plates dont regen unless you have the impact plate but most skills exclude effects on these, meaning you have another limited resource to manage leading to moments where you have no armour, no way of replenishing it and no way to regen more health. (keep in mind I dont hate the bodyvest/armour plate system but it needs more work and more options)

Things I like
 - Gunplay is good
 - Missions are fun (if not a whole new level of pain on stealth with new mechanics)
They also ported classics from PD2 and PD1
 - Weapon, Mask, Loadout, mission and just the UI usability has been greatly improved for an alround better UX (with the exception of the weapon store mentioned earlier)
 - Customisation is good, would like to see more flexibility to paint individual parts how you want them but ultimately offers enough to satisfy most people. Be also nice to see more outfit options, maybe some more variations on outfits and with masks.

I can see why people don't hate PD3 but also don't love it either, but this is still a fun game and have genuinely been having a blast with it.
I also dont get all the hate for the Devs, yeah they fumbled the bag with PD3 but they are passionate about the franchise and we've seen theyll stick with and keep working on the game  constantly like they did with PD2. Altho it had a bad release this is definatly not a slop game. If the devs can keep afloat then I know that this review will be out of date in a few years time as they add content and tinker with the game. Wait for a sale if you must but definatly give this game a chance

P.S. Add Sangrez plz

Payday 3 is objectively worse than Payday 2. I will change my review when Payday 3 is at least as good as Payday 2.

If you care about Payday 3, then force Starbreeze to make it better by leaving a negative review to impact their sales.

Payday 3's issues since Day 1:

Barely any heists
- We have only 16 (10 at launch) short heists with little replayability
- Very little RNG elements in heists, especially non-dlc heists
- Why can't we have Payday 2 level variety on how to complete heists (multiple escapes/breaches)?
- Payday 2 has over 70 heists

No Multiday Heists
- Payday 3 should have been released with at least 30 heists, 10 being multi-day

Most heists are short
- I can solo most in under 12 mins on the hardest difficulty easily

Live Service only
- Even Solo mode requires a ping before and after the game, often failing
- Matchmaking was terrible, became bad and is terrible again now with crimenet
- Want to host a lobby? Get ready to wait several minutes...
- random disconnections, single lost network packet can disconnect you
- 150ms lag feels like 600ms lag in any normal game
- 5 min heist loading
- UI freezes when loading, sometimes infinite
- long loading if 1 player has bad internet
- Sometimes instant disconnection after joining a lobby
- Still have the can't ready up bug sometimes

Obvious game breaking bugs take forever to fix:
- Cook off has had crashing issues since launch
- Cook off escape van IS STILL BROKEN since 9 months ago (maybe fixed today)
- Diamond District stuck door
- Invisible enemies
- Countless stuck objectives
- UE4 is a decade old and very stable, bad Starbreeze code crashing game
- It feels like little to no QA is done before releasing and update
- Forget PD2 hotfixes, never had any

No heists with large maps
- At least a 5/30 should be large maps

Few interesting heists
- No real creativity for the jobs the gang does
- Execution (ie drilling/hacking) is also pretty boring
- Why are there still wifi circles after a whole year???

No Preplanning
- Can only order basic assets without placing them

Many missing PD2 mechanics like driving

AI teammates are stupid
- Cannot be instructed to wait and don't help with objectives
- Sometimes don't even revive you if you are downed
- Often broken/stuck (Fear & Greed)
- Cannot have their loadouts, weapons or skills changed

Enemies are bland
- Crowds of bullet sponge swat that do little damage to players
- Only new special is the Nader (who was broken for most of this year)
- Tasers are now called Zappers and are barely a threat
- Only one variant of Bulldozer with an auto-shotgun
- Bulldozers can only target a single player and are slow to retarget

Cloakers are too buggy
- Attack through walls/corners
- Always target players even if you're the last one
- Can't be heard that well (were silent most of this year)
- Can only be stopped by a one shot kill when they close charge you
- Spawn from the same closest location every wave end so are easy to expect

Heisters to play as are lacking
- Only 7 playable heisters, PD2 has 22
- Voicelines are bland and few
- Barely any situational voicelines and no banter between heisters

Skills are super bland and boring
- No drill skills, Inspire, Joker, Pistol Messiah or any interesting skills for that matter
- I personally hate the new Armor plate economy, PD2 armor was perfect
- No perk decks to make cool builds
- No infamy system/rewards
- Too easy to become 150, other players' renown levels hidden
- Edge, Grit, Rush effects are an unnoticeable 10%

Music is acceptable but worse than PD2
- Only dlc heists have good music + Diamond District
- No ability to change heists' music
- No access to PD2/PDTH soundtrack

The UI is still bad
- No number stats of weapons in UI, have to look these up online
- Can't move guns around/sell preset guns
- Weapons have same inventory icon regardless of which mods/skins are on it
- Way too many large buttons/text which lead to unnecessary sub-pages and submenus
- Can't manage party/other players directly from main menu/esc screen
- No value of items shown when grabbed/secured
- Separate control for marking than interacting unlike PD2
- Kicked to main menu after heist (can opt-in and wait 60s to form party which nobody does)

Few weapons
- No melee weapons at all
- No saw
- Very few guns and the meta ones are all DLC
- Same high fire rate and one shot kill weapons used for Overkill
- No weapon lasers nor flashlights
- Weapon sights cannot have the reticle changed at all
- Secondary weapons all crazy suck except for DLC ones since Houston Breakout
- No exciting weapons like Flamethrower, RPG or medieval weapons
- Since day 1 we've begged to get rid of the OVK weapon system
- No weapon skins that allow you to freely change mods

Few Throwables
- Grenade barely does any damage
- No cool throwables except the shock grenade
- Only get 2 knives which break when hitting a wall

Few achievements:
- Despite the little content, there should still be more achievements

Equipment sucks
- Ecms are now useless, except disabling one camera you can reach
- Infrasonic mines that you manually detonate to temporarily stun instead of tripmines
- No c4
- Sentries are now a deployable so nobody uses them over Armor Bags

Few masks
- Most masks are overdone and feel too ridiculous to ever wear
- Very few patterns to choose from
- Preset masks cannot be customized
- No interesting materials
- No cool masks compared to PD2

No Deathwish
- Overkill is way too easy, never had to first play other difficulties
- FBI van is stupid easy

Modifiers can't be changed
- For the last few months, almost every heist has the 2 specials and blinding shield modifiers
- I would like to enable all of them for more pay, they can't be changed

Pros over PD2 (this is why I would accept at least 30 heists vs PD2's 70 at launch)
+ Graphics gorgeous compared to PD2 but very unoptimized (ppl with 4080s are getting lag spikes)
+ Mask off stealth has more depth but now stealthing is way too easy
+ More heists with code locks which are cool to guess
+ Hostage system is better
+ Final Wave mechanic to make securing all loot harder
+ Fixed Naders are a cool threat
+ Bulldozers can melee kick and charge players
+ Cool animations when doing most interactions
+ Microcams/motion sensors useful and pretty cool
+ Shields have window to take them out through

For a game that had a promising lead into release, I was genuinely excited about the game.
Something changed with the negative perception, made me realize I should temper my expectations. Then I actually got the game.
Man, is this game a tragic story.

Payday 2 is true lightning in a bottle and everything they did with this was change for the sake of change, removing perk decks, making the Rush/Edge/Grit system a requirement to engage with any of your skills, the guns having little variety, including the instant meta that came to be that basically destroyed Overkill as "truly hard with no need for additional difficulties like PD2." I truly think this game isn't going to work out, and I believe that they're going to ditch it in the future to make more content for Payday 2.

Right now, the game just isn’t worth it. The core idea is fun, and the heists feel different from the first two games. Being able to sneak around without putting your mask on adds some really tense and exciting moments.

But the game’s got way too many issues holding it back. You need to be online to play — even in “offline” mode — and during heists you’ll often run into stutters or random disconnects. When that happens, you lose all your progress, which is beyond frustrating.

Maybe if they fix the servers and polish things up in the future, it could be worth giving another shot. But for now, I’d skip it.

There's a hell of a lot in PD3 that should be improved, and there are very many very valid complaints to be made about its development, or lack thereof. The last 2 years of new content and reworks have done a lot of good, but PD3 is nowhere near where it could - and should, really - be. Putting that to one side, I love this game.

I'm going to make comparisons to the last game because it's what most people know and/or are coming from, including myself; I'm >1500 hours deep in PD2.

PD2 has this licked for sheer volume and variety of content, for innate replayability, and for most things you could try to measure, but I always have more fun playing PD3. Why? Well, this is how it feels to me. PD2 has a huge amount of good quality content and a well sorted progression system, but this is overshadowed by its consistently clunky, awkward, and dated gameplay. PD3 is comparatively anaemic with flawed, poorly developed systems, but is at its core a more refined and better feeling experience.

The standout improvements are to the core combat and gunplay. Gone are huge swarms of brain-dead bullet sponge cops. Shots-to-kill feel now intentionally thought out and reasonable, and no longer change significantly between difficulties. Enemies now act and react in half believable ways, and spawnrates are more manageable.
Almost all weapons look, sound, and feel amazing to use. The step up over PD2 is massive; no more reused reload animations, ugly models, or desynced auto-fire sounds! 
Add to these things the less floaty movement and new first-person animations for interactions, and what you have is a player character that feels better to control in combat that feels better to engage with, and in a game that is much better to look at.
Could you believe it, even, that the awful armour system that PD3 released with has since been reworked into something better than PD2's? And there's still a good amount of PAYDAY personality to the music, heists, and characters.

Like I said earlier, I do feel this game needs a lot of work. I acknowledge and am very often dealing with its problems. My experience would be much improved if these problems were worked on, but as PD3 stands, that experience is still a good one. Like I've said over and over in this review, it just feels better to play than PD2, and I do think is worth consideration even in its current state - though do try to buy it on sale if you can :)

As someone who has been playing Payday 2 & 3 since launch, don't bother with this piece of shit. 

This game is boring, repetitive, lacking in content, flawed (online-only), and not improving at all aside from bugfixes & UI changes (it's been 2 years).
The only compliments I can give this game are: Gustavo Coutinho's music is great, Jacket's Sociopath overskill weapon is fun, faces & hair don't look as scuffed compared to Payday 2, and the new Wolf VA is good. That's it.
I had hope for this game, I wanted to give them a chance and fix & improve the game, "give them time" like some people will tell you, but it has been 2 goddamn years and nothing has improved, in fact it just gets worse and worse, especially after their recent announcement about cancelling offline mode. Basically if you have internet issues, or their servers fuck up (again), you can't play the game you paid for.
This game is basically a worse, subjectively "prettier" Payday 2 with less content, boring objectives, and some additional gimmicks. 
Not to mention most of the new content in this game is already locked behind DLCs, and it was already this way during Year 1 which is pretty bad for a game with so many issues they should be focusing on instead of releasing fucking DLCs. Starbreeze seems to be only interested in milking as much money as possible from the players with the least amount of effort (As seen with the recent Payday 2 subscription & DLC bundle price increase, also Delivery Charge is more expensive because... they felt like it?)

If I had the opportunity to refund this, I'd do it in a heartbeat.
If you really want to play a Payday game, play Payday 2, Payday: The Heist (assuming they won't ruin those), or even Notoriety on Roblox instead.
Stay FAR away from this game, and don't trust Starbreeze.

I previously gave this game a negative review, as it's majorly impacted by the lack of an ability to establish a lobby. You can't talk with people before the match starts, you can't discuss what to do during a heist. The heists have a lot of interesting mechanics and gimmicks, but you'll struggle to achieve them or find out how they work because they require team work that just isn't feasible without a lobby.

Gone are the days of vetting newbies before the mission, guiding them through the mechanics. Now everyone is thrown in blindly, over and over again, without a real chance to learn. It took me over 15 hours in the game to understand how to navigate some of the more complex missions.

However, besides that, the game is genuinely fun to play. Admittedly, the enemies are a little spongy regarding body shots, but otherwise the combat feels very good. Moving around feels buttery smooth, with vaulting and climbing through windows stream-lined. I'd love to be able to actually plan the heist with the other players ahead of time with a fully functional and easily visible chat, but what is already in the game is fun enough for me to recommend it despite the confusion created by the lack of a lobby feature.

Wow, this game is a hot mess. So many things lost from Payday 2 when coming into this game, you question what's the point of a sequel when it has less content and its worse overall.

I won't go into detail given the countless negative reviews commenting on how this game sucks, so I'll just comment on my least favorite aspect of this game.

The cop animations are vastly inferior than Payday 2. In that game, cops reacted in a multitude of ways depending of the angles they're shot from. They would occasionally trip and fall, spending time to regain their footing. If shot on the back, they would throw their arms in surprise and fall forward. They even have an unique animation if you shot them in the balls. That energy is sorely missing in Payday 3. They brush off bullets as if they were airsoft pallets. They don't even throw themselves on the floor anymore to escape line of fire, they just occasionally sidestep and ragdoll on death.

No matter how much they rework Payday 3's skill or armor system like how they've been trying to do for over two years (holy fuck), this level of detail and energy on the cops is something we'll never see again.

As much as I love this game and there are improvements in (SOME) areas of the game compared to the 2nd, I can't recommend it, because as of the 2nd anniversary stream, this game has an expiration date, so that means any money you put into this game will eventually be money you could have bought something else with that will always be accessible.

Offline mode has been the most talked about thing in the community and it was finally being realised during Operation Medic Bag. Now it's cancelled. It's obvious why, it's not because it's "not feasible", it's because of greed, most likely.

They are capable of making offline work, as they already displayed in the "BETA" offline mode, but they just want certain things that they wouldn't able to do without making us play Online 24/7. If they gave a damn about their players, they would make sure Offline mode was going to happen. They've shown us they don't care.

Played this game at launch on Xbox Game Pass, and only came back for the 2nd anniversary discount. The improvements since then are noticeable and appreciated, but even with Starbreeze’s promising direction, Payday 3 still struggles with replayability as it gets dull after just a few runs. The maps feel like a jumble of reused assets rather than the creative playgrounds of PD1 and PD2. The new Delivery Charge heist does help by adding more RNG. But at the end of the day, it’s still just another warehouse heist.

Hosting options remain barebones. There’s no way to set infamy limits or properly shape your crew, so lobbies are a gamble. Even when I set a heist to Overkill, level 1 players can still join.

Honestly, the only reason I came back to this game is cuz I had fun playing with friends and have a bit of hope that the franchise will return to its former glory. (I will surely regret it later)

I bought this game on release and waited literally two years for it to become fun. It still isn't.

Oh yeah and the always online feature is here to stay after a promised offline mode was scrapped. Please don't give starbreeze any of your money, they don't deserve it.

After 20 hours (including beta time) I have reached over lvl 100, I have bought most heist/weapon dlcs, and kept up with all the blogs, videos, etc. I can confidently say that this game is DISEASED with an out of touch company who have a very small amount of competency for the game they've created.

Here's the short of it

[h1] PROS [/h1] 
-Gunplay that's SO GOOD I don't know if I'll be able to return to PD2's weapons

-Beautiful animations for guns, characters, and the new contextual ones for objectives

-Interesting setting with a large focus on technology and digital age gadgets/heists

-Cool new cops with updated designs and mechanics

-New "phases" for missions that'll make gameplay more progressive instead of stagnant for the entire level.

Yup, that's all the good.
Ok here's the thing you're here for

[h1] CONS [/h1] 
-The worst UI I've probably seen from any shooter let alone any game I've played
Like for real THE GUNS AREN'T EVEN SEPARATED BY WEAPON TYPE! SECONDARIES ARE ALSO IN THE SAME SLOT AS PRIMARIES! HOW, HOW DO YOU F​U​C​K​I​N​G DO THIS??

-While the heists are mostly... ok. They don't have multi-day heists, escape heists, no bosses or unique enemies for the level. Most maps aren't randomized like in PD2. Unless you wanna count placement of keycards and minor stuff like that. Also cook-off isn't an infinite heist which blows p​e​n​i​s.

-I'm sure everyone's aware but I'll still put it here anyway. The skill system is dog s​h​i​t and revolves around 3 different modifiers. That being EDGE, GRIT, and RUSH. The idea of these 3 BEING in skills aren't the problem. It's just that the entire skill tree FOCUSES on these solely with like 5 individual skills actually giving you a unique mechanic. Just like the UI, it's super confusing.

-This game, while better than beta, is buggy as f​u​c​k. I promise you I am not suffering from mental r​e​t​a​r​d​a​t​i​o​n when I say I had a moment playing cook-off when the intercom bitch told me to put in a chemical and I even waited for her to confirm it, yknow? Like wait for that second line that comes after it to make sure she didn't mess up the ingredients. I put it in AND THE F​UC​K​I​N​G LAB BLEW UP AFTER ONLY 5 BAGS. 

-The team behind it wants to upgrade to Unreal Engine 5, but why? The engine they got now works just fine. Plus WHO WANTS THIS? I've heard literally NOBODY say anything positive about UE5. How about you actually add content?

-Guns are level-up progression now like in COD. It's ok... but I would rather just build my guns than grind for attachments. This locks players out of opportunities in heists because they hafta use a s​h​i​t weapon for 10 hours to unlock something that would make the weapon actually viable.

                                                                   [LAST BUT NOT LEAST]
Content. Why would I ever play PayDay 3 instead of PayDay 2? it suffers from a lack of Heists, weapons, customization, heisters, mechanics, etc etc etc. To be fair this isn't JUST a PayDay 3 issue, but it's still a valid criticism.

As someone who bought the silver edition and stuck around since launch day, i have to say.

The game STILL isn't worth your money. does not matter what amount. its the worse version of a product you can have infinitely more fun with (and no, im not talking about the one with a subscription service added onto it.)

There are currently 16 heists in the game. This sounds good doesnt it, considering the standard the previous 2 games have set, right? Well, no, actually. There is little, if not ZERO randomisation in this game. No changes in objectives, no randomized events that could change the way you play a heist. Nothing. The very first game, PAYDAY: The Heist did this, and I've had way more fun with it than this zygote of a game.

Now lack of variety shouldn't really matter if the gameplay loop is fun, right? Wrong again! The game has tried to appeal to fans of both PAYDAY: The Heist and PAYDAY 2 by introducing a mixture of both the boots-on-the-ground gameplay where it feels like you're a nobody going up against the world, and the power fantasy of the second where it feels like youre a one man army. it fails on both of these fronts. Half of the reason why PAYDAY 2's power fantasy gameplay worked was because of build variety-- it never mattered how many cops you were slaughtering, but because you made something that could kill thousands of cops at a time.

And now they have told us that there will be no online mode whatsoever. You are buying Milk: the video game.

Buy PAYDAY The Heist and Postal 2 instead. you'll get infinitely more hours from those games.

I wanted to like Payday 3 As someone who’s spent a decent amount playing Payday 2 I was hopeful it will be identical with better graphics and continuation of the story. But this game is a massive letdown, and now with the cancellation of offline mode, I’m done. So here’s my honest review:

Cons:
- As of this review, they’ve announced that offline mode is cancelled.
- Base game just feels trashy, running to objectives feels awkward, and combat just doesn't feel satisfying. It doesn’t feel satisfying to do anything.
- The music is bad, unenjoyable, just background noise you’ll forget exists five minutes later (i had to download a jukebox mod with the payday 2 music just to have a better time).
- The objectives are boring and not fun. You're telling me I have to stand in a circle to "catch Wi-Fi"? XD
- The Edge Rush system is garbage. They mentioned a "Skill Points 2.0" update, but haven’t given a date, so who knows if or when that’s actually coming.
- The voice lines for the character "Shade" sound cheap and robotic, almost like they were generated by text-to-speech, There's no personality, no intensity — just lifeless lines that take you out of the moment.
- The special cops are just bullet sponges with zero personality, not challenging at all, and in general, Taking out cops in Payday 2 felt impactful, in Payday 3 it just isn't...
- The new CEO, Adolf Kristjansson, previously worked at EA so you already know where this is going.
- Microtransactions

Pros:
- If you just pretend the Payday franchise doesn’t exist, or any heist game in that matter, like if this was the first ever heist game you might think it’s alright.
-Stealth is fun (except for the circle objectives).
- The graphics look good

Final Thoughts:
The game is a complete mess. they’ve officially scrapped offline play,  That means when the servers go down and trust me, they will, the game will become completely unplayable. It's 2025 and we're still pretending always online is acceptable for a PvE co-op game? The only reason its online is because of the microtransactions.
Trust me, this isn’t going to be like No Man’s Sky redemption arc.
If you haven’t bought Payday 3 yet: don’t. If you already did, i hope you didn’t pay full price. And if you’re still holding on for a comeback... I respect your hope, but I wouldn’t count on it.
All i can say is IT'S OVER. Its MY FAULT for having hopes for this game, i doubt i will change my review for this game unless most of the cons will be fixed.

This game is so bad. I really wanted to give it a chance, but it’s just terrible I don’t even feel excited to play it.

I waited for them to fix the game, maybe add map adjustments or a pre-planning system or something like that… but no. Instead, you have to complete another map just to unlock assets. Like, how dumb is that? I’ve got money and I want to spend it but nope.

Then there’s the dumb skill system, which I don’t even ****ing understand. You need to keep playing just to unlock another skill tree even though you already have skill points to spend. OMG, how does that make any sense? It’s just bad design.

There also aren’t many maps. Payday 2 had 11 maps at launch, and some even had Day 1, Day 2, and Day 3 variations. I loved doing Framing Frame with my friends in Payday 2 — I don’t even know how many times we finished it. But in Payday 3? I haven’t finished a single map in stealth because it’s so boring and unnecessarily hard. Like, you’re trying to rob a penthouse, and the map is tiny, yet there are a ton of security guards and cameras everywhere. It’s just frustrating instead of fun.

They even said they wouldn’t release Payday 2 maps — and then immediately broke that promise. Why? Because payday 3 maps are so boring.

And when you finish all the objectives, the game throws an endless assault at you that you can’t do anything about. It never stops. There are always cops shooting at you while you’re trying to get the bags to the van. It’s beyond frustrating.

There isn’t even a good story. In Payday 2, saving Hoxton actually felt cool. But here? You save Houston. Wow. What an original idea.

And even then, I still remember how amazing those Hoxton moments were in Payday 2. We were genuinely excited there were small things like Hoxton singing a Christmas song, little conversations about him and that big Dentist reveal. Those moments were awesome. Hoxton Breakout was such a hype event too.

If you’re going to copy and paste something, at least do it properly. You have great voice actors, but you don’t even use them well. Back then, they would release short story films and we’d watch them over and over again. Now? They don’t even bother doing that.

As an avid fan of PayDay2, I purchased this game on sale for $10 two years after its release. I played it for 119 minutes as the refund requirement does not allow more than 2 hours of play. I refunded it, went to Chick-Fil-A and purchased a spicy deluxe, mac and cheese, and a large pepsi for $15 (150% of what I paid for PayDay3).  Take my word for it, go to Chick-Fil-A.

Always loved the Payday series. And still love 3 despite its flaws. Its solid and now has a good amount of content worth picking up on a sale and I hope you do as I want these devs to get all the support they can get so they can keep developing this game. Hoping to one day even see a Payday 4.

I don't think it's a bad game by any means; it's fun and the combat has a satisfying punch to it. The graphics, 3D models, textures, and optimization are overall pretty good, especially when compared to its dated predecessor. The gameplay and mission design feel well-rounded and more polished.

However, it definitely falls short when compared to the plethora of content that PAYDAY 2 offers. PAYDAY 3 should have more content (heists, weapons, cosmetics, enemy types, etc.) to play with, as well as much more long-term progression to keep the player interested. It's good that they are taking steps such as adding the Skill Tree to help alleviate this lack of progression, but more steps need to be taken to even be on par with the amount of PAYDAY 2's content.

That said, I don't think it's the right idea to be adding paywalled DLCs at this point in time. It's simply too early; there should be more free heists and free weapons offered to the player before locking new items behind a cost, especially since the game is paid access to begin with. I understand that revenue is crucial, but it would be a shame if lack of funding is what's withholding the success of this game.

I am leaving a [b] Positive Review [/b] with the notion that Starbreeze is taking these criticisms in mind and is working to repair the tarnished reputation of this game, because I genuinely believe the game has a solid foundation for a fun co-op shooter. I believe it's still worth playing (especially with friends), and it's worth to pick up while on sale.

I also thought this game was bad. At the beggining I really thought it was a downgrade from the second one, but it honestly isn't. Now, this doesn't mean there's nothing bad about the game, obviously, but it's not as bad as some people say. 
I must admit, I was extremely wrong about the game. Let's go with my overall opinion on everything.
Let's start with the heists, which I believe to be it's weakest point. They are, boring. And this is a big issue, because the whole point of the game is playing the heists. I believe they are pretty basic and uninteresting and they lack replayability. I liked payday 1 and 2 heists more. Payday 2 also had bad heists but they were overall pretty solid. I'd really like to see The Bomb: Forest in this game, it was one of my favorites in payday 2, the layout of the map and the design is amazing. What I mean is, in payday 2 you'd steal interesting things (some times) but here you never do that. The most "Interesting" thing you steal is a crypto wallet... if we can call that interesting. 
Skills, aren't that bad. I honestly really enjoy the Rush, Grit and Edge system. I don't think it's that bad, I think it needs some upgrades, but that's never going to happen because they announced skills 2.0 recently and the E, G and R system is going down the drain. 
Gameplay wise, I really like it. I think that the shootouts are much more fun than payday 2. I believe it to be an upgrade of PDTH. This game, seems like an upgraded version (mostly, not heists´ wise for example) of the first game.
Enemies are pretty solid. I like them much more than in payday 2. Cloakers are kind of scary tbh, tasers are much more efficient here, and don't make you waste all your mag when they tase you; Bulldozers are tankier and more lethal. Snipers I believe to be well balanced. I've heard some people complain about how much they take to shoot at you, but you have to think about how much it takes for your plates to regen (If you have them equipped) and how much damage the sniper does to your armor. If you have no armor regen then one sniper only can make you use an armor box. Then there's this 2 new specials called the Nader, who throws gas grenades; and the Techy, who makes drones appear while they are alive. 
I also really like the weapons. What I don't like are the modifications, as they don't really seem to make much difference. You notice your weapons being stronger due to what skills you have equipped and not your weapon mods. 
Stealth is another big topic. I think it's a really big improbement from the second game. What I dislike is that you need almost all the good stealth perks to be able to complete even one mission. In payday 2 you were able to complete a stealth mission as your 5-10th mission, here it's impossible. You need to grind assault until you have enough skill points. I really dislike that, but the stealth itself is really good. 
Overall, I think it's a pretty solid game. Flawed, but not as much as people make it seem. It's quite enjoyable.
