TL:TL:DR -> This game is fundamentally not fun in 2025 and it won't be in 2035 either (no matter the sale)

TL:DR -> 
Playing this game after having played payday 2 is like going to an ice cream parlor and ordering vanilla ice cream with sprinkes.
Except you're brought chocolate ice cream, with 1/3rd of the size, and the sprinkles have been replaced with micro turds.

Chocolate: Completely different game to payday 2
Size: Literally 1/5th the heists, 1/2 of the perks, 1/10th the weapons
Turd Replacement: This game literally devolves mechanics or in some cases straight up guts them.

Actual Review:
As someone that has ~450 hours on payday 2, this game is an upgrade graphically and really pretty to look at, but a fundamental downgrade in every single other aspect of this game.

I purposefully waited over a year to try this out because the devs have shown such care for payday 2 that I knew this wouldn't get abandoned. However after playing I realized that this game is just fundamentally not fun. Unless it gets a complete rework, or I get amnesia and forget how great payday 2 plays, I will never recommend this game, even tho I know that this will be supported for the next 5-10 years with amazing updates.

Upon installation I was greeted with a login page which i haven't seen since 2015 runescape genre games, not a great start after realizing this means that you can't play without internet, however not an incredible obstacle considering the year.

Upon launching the tutorial immediately I noticed just how wrong it feels to play this. All the controls have been swapped out and merged which makes rearranging them a complete nightmare because all of the sudden I have 'F' marking guards and emoting for some reason instead of it being 2 separate buttons. Crouch jumping is completely gone and instead replaced with a slide which doesn't work in stealth at all. The perk tree is unbearable to look at, I genuinely don't understand how the perk tree made it past the initial concept stages, nonetheless its there.

Unfortunately due to a lack of players, the servers you'll be connecting to are going to be trash, this is coming from someone that's typically on US-West servers, your experience may vary, and this isn't a fault of the developers rather just a by-product of a low player-base.

On the topic of stealth I completed an entire heist without having to mask up, which for any payday 2 players might sound like a dream but the moment you actually try it you realize immediately how boring it is and how much it affects the replayability. Oh goodluck trying to stealth on higher difficulties too, with the incredibly broken AI, incredibly broken guard sensitivity mechanic, and the overall laginess of camera detection, on top of taking away 2 pagers and adding in an unkillable roaming guard. Stealth has been completely to remove as much fun as possible for the sake of "added challenge"

Cherry on top: Shade or whatever her name is, is completely insufferable to listen to (subjective opinion).

After realizing how boring stealth was (at this point I already knew I was going to refund this), I launched up a loud heist just to see if there was ANY replayability, and I'll grant it this is an aspect of the game that can become GREAT with future updates, however seeing how bad the stealth is and just how incredibly un-fixable it is, I have to refund it.

This game is supposed to be an absolute 10/10 and its clear that so many passionate people worked on this project, however somewhere down the line in the command chain someone was either completely oblivious or just didn't care to understand what made playing PayDay 2 so phenomenal, and it casts an incredibly great shadow over the entire game that for me personally was so great that I had to send in a refund within 1 hour of playtime.

I feel sorry because someone incredibly fundamental to this games core mechanics just didn't CARE, and it has completely tarnished the entire game. Unless there is an entire gameplay focused rework announced I will never try this game again, I haven't even gotten to see what this game is worth because of how abhorrent it felt to play.

Edit: After looking into the NEW CEO of Starbreeze's past (The guy behind EA's 10 year long micro transaction hell) I can for certain say that even if this game has SOME fun aspects to it. It is literally cooked in its longevity aspect, if it cant even match 1/5th of paydays content size, then rest assured it will never even get close to it in the future since player numbers are dwindilling and resources are getting scarcer, expect at the very most 5 paid for dlc maps before this game is completely abandoned due to revenue stream.

As a huge fan of Payday 2 this is nothing but a stark reminder that corporate greed will mercilessly ruin everything and anything in order to gain temporary monatery funds. I plan on fully completing this game as a thank you to the wonderful game devs at Overkill, and then never touching this again unless a fairy tale happens and Starbreeze decides to actually invest into this and give the players an abundance of content for free.

as the new updates roll around this game is getting better everyday, at release it was horrible and unplayable. Now this is a game I would buy. Obviously not up to the level of Payday 2 yet but i would get this again if I didnt have it (8.5/10)

This is by far one of the most conflicting feeling reviews I have ever had to make.

I love the idea of this game being great. It has the bones of being a proper successor to Payday 2, HOWEVER it lacks the massive hoard of content and character that Payday 2 has. The overall game feel is much more refined, FPS is massively improved, the graphics look *good*, the game doesn't crash. Overall what they've done is make what looks more like a proof of concept or a tech demo then an actual game compared to Payday 2.

We all knew that due to the massive buildup of DLC and drip feed content in Payday 2 it makes this game look tiny in comparison, but it makes things much harder to justify playing Payday 3 over 2.

I'm only giving it a recommended rating because of the potential. There is a real chance that over time the game improves as more content is added, but right now I'm not sure I'd pay full price for it.

When this game first came out there was some struggles here and there. I was very upset that it was only online and this is shared with others. After a year and multiple changes this game has become fantastic to revisit. I 100% Payday 2 and I plan to do the same with this game.  Its definitely different than payday 2 in a lot of ways. Recoil, skills, damage, move speed, movement, and a couple of other things. My favorite is the skills. In Payday 2 you had to gain xp then you can use it to buy those perk cards and skills. This one they are all roped in together. You research the sets and you only need to research the first one. Afterwards, every game you play you get a number of xp that goes TO EACH CARD IN THAT SET! I used to spend hours grinding just to max out the perk deck and skills. Here you research a set, play, and eventually unlock them. Going back to skills you can mix which ones you want. I think you are little limited on what you can use together. However, the build potential is still there and probably better. Stealth was a huge part of Payday 2 for me. In Payday 3 you can run the traits of yakuza for speed then have the abilities of hacker. It is astounding the builds you can make. I hope they continue to update this game and add the old heist. Cook off one of my favorites is a blast and easier. The announced chemicals you have to put in are usually 90% correct unlike Bain. The small stabs to the previous version is hilarious. 100% recommend people grab this game.

Don't bother. I bought it for 9 bucks and I still feel like that was too much for this and would like 30 bucks back for it.

90% of the playtime is waiting on Loading Times, the Default Keybinds are horrible, the mask and clothing options are horrendous, Solo Mode is STILL Unfinished even nearly 2 years after release so you're forced into Multiplayer, and new mechanics/features that make certain objectives hell to go through compared to PayDay 2.

And for some reason enemies won't spawn with guns so they're not even a threat, the DIALOG LAGS (how do you fuck that up??), Bulldozers and Cloakers spawn on the lowest difficulty (for some reason??) and the new "Dye Packs" mechanic is completely unneccessary. "Oh but we wanted to make it more realistic!" well how about you focus on making the game work properly first or even fun and then worry about that? maybe tie that to a difficulty setting?

I was big into Payday 2 and I do understand why so many fans might not like this game. However I will say overall this is a very fun game and it does feel like payday. I think my biggest gripe is the lack of content while also placing so much of the existing content behind paywalls. I understand the company needs to make money so they can create more content in the future but there's a fine balance between a fully operable base game and DLC. It's very frustrating to pay the $30-$60 for a game that has half of the content its previous entry had at launch. There seems to be very few weapons and masks to choose from along with not that much gun customization, and the little that their is is all the same. All the rifles have the same stocks and none of them seem unique at all along with them taking away the lasers and flashlight attachments, not sure why they did that. Now I'm not saying that this game should have had everything Payday 2 now has at launch because that's an unfair comparison. Payday 2 has been out for a long time, all I'm saying is I would have liked to see the same amount as Payday 2 when that game first launched, I believe that's fare. Along with some bugs and laggy servers every now and then. I do understand that by the time I started playing Payday 3 a lot of those bugs had been patched so I'm seeing the best Payday 3 can be at the moment. So overall at the time of this review I will say that I'm highly enjoying this game and I can't wait to see what the developers do. And of course, I'm hoping it's not all locked behind a paywall. To leave this review on a positive note I do very much enjoy the changes they have made such as being able to hold hostages and guards not immediately shooting you in private areas. I think this adds realism and better strategic planning for heisters. And I love love love that your XP stays with you throughout the missions and that host changes happen when the original host leaves. This was a HUGE frustration I had with Payday 2. The gun play does feel slower but still Payday and I don't mind it. Also the ability to carry two bags is amazing, I know it's small but it's these things that truly make it a great game and great additions to the Payday franchise. I will probably be playing this game for a long time. Again of course, as long as the paywalls aren't too high.

Разочарование

Так одним словом можно описать эту игру. Я когда купил этот продукт, думал получу геймплей PAYDAY 2 2013-2014 годов, когда еще была командная игра, оружия были сбалансированы примерно одинаковы и вообще трава была зеленей, вместо этого я получил какую-то недопародию с убогим геймплеем и системой прокачки как у дешевых инди рпг игр.

 Эту игру нельзя сравнивать с серией PAYDAY. Она не должна носить это гордое название и носить цифру 3. Эту игру можно назвать жалкой копией другой копии - Crime Boss: Rockay City. Эта игра по сути не имеет ничего общего ни с PAYDAY The Heist, ни с PAYDAY 2. Эту игру делали не для того чтобы порадовать фанатов и подарить примерно такой же геймплей. Разработчики даже не хотят чинить кривую и убогую оптимизацию, вместо этого они уже выкатили DLC чтобы состричь $$$.

Первым делом зайдя на самое первое ограбление из трейлеров "сбербанк" как его называют рускоязычные фанаты. Я для меня было удивление увидеть в этой игре спустя 2 года после релиза прямо ну очень убогую оптимизацию. Лаги сопровождают начало ограбления, затем лаги проходят, выходит нормальные фпс ~80-90 К/C и сопровождаются неожиданными дропами до 10 К/С, затем спустя время все нормально. Тоесть о приятной игре не может идти и речи.

Чувство от попадания в тушку копа с любого огнестрельного оружия нет абсолютно никаого, попал ты или нет ты понимаешь не по характерному отскоку/падению или регдолу, а по хитмаркеру. Разработчики специально сделали хитмаркер чтобы ты понимал, что стала с твоим врагом после выстрела. Понять этого до того как коп упадет на землю НЕ-РЕ-А-ЛЬ-НО!

Прокачка в этой игре является как в очень дешевой инди игре, тоесть вот ты играешь с car-4 и прокачиваешь его уровень когда поиграешь по-больше он станет имбой, про особый подбор атачментов для оружии я молчу как это сделано в PAYDAY 2, больше похоже на уровень The Heist. Об уровне билдостроения в PAYDAY 2 (даже после 100 update) не может идти речи.

 Разделения сложности абсолютно бессмысленно, я начиная с 8 уровня игра на сложности "очень трудно" при этом падал дай ты бог 1 раз за всю игру и то либо от случайного падения либо от неожиданного клокера. Спустя время и сложность "overkill" стала смехотворной. Често сказать сложость я надеялся будет как в PAYDAY 2 оверкилл после 24.2 update'а и максимальная к примеру death wish, которая повторюсь до 2016 года была действительно тяжелой сложностью, но при этом если иметь полностью подготовленную команду людей которые работают в команде становится хоть и не легкой, но вполне выполнимой задачей.

Дальше можно подметить почти полное отсутсвие сюжета, такое чувства что его просто нету. Добавили очередную тупую 3.14зду феменистку, которая абсолютно и беспреворотно не вписывается в стиль, в отличии от загадочного Бэйна.

Вообщем если подвести черту -  хочешь погриндить, иди в игры для этого например в path of exile, grim dawn на крайняк PAYDAY The Heist. Все таки я думал что разработчики пофиксили за 2 с лишнем годом игру. Оказалось что забии хyй. Если хотите поиграть в действительно хороший симулятор про ограблений с интересным пусть и гриндом, прокачкой, лором, сюжетом то вам дорога на старый PAYDAY 2 до 2016 года. Мой гайд на установку старых версий и depotdownloader в помощь. А на этом раз ты дочитал этот обзор до конца то благодарю за прочтение.

Game is good from the perspective of gameplay, it's signature style, music and new features. They added new mechanics, made it more casual in some parts but decision to make it completely online is the main problem. 
Graphic stays the same as payday 2. They added more poligons, details, interiors became more filled and so on but faces and bodies of guards and civs stay the same. Maybe it's their style or it was made for age restriction but it looks like update of their old engine not new Unreal Engine.
It's impossible to play stealth missions with random 1-2 sec freezes. I lost many 30mins+ stealth missions cause of this. When you try to look out guards behind walls and it happens you find yourself after 2 secs of freeze in the middle of corridor or room in a view of guard with half filled scale of detection. Even in solo mode problems stay. 
And like in Payday 2 there are a huge amount of cash grabbing dlc's but they were able to do it even worse. You can't connect to created by another player dlc maps like in Payday 2 if you don't own it. 
Many bugs with chat (or with windowed/full screen mode?), bugs with spotted enemies and civilians, ai behavior, long creation of lobbies, errors due connection, due lobby creation even if you buy weapons or mods it can disconnect you or give you infinite loading. You can't open your game to public after you completed it in solo stealth in <with friends> mode, can't kick in lobby and problems with borderless window/full screen that drop your fps significantly. 
In 2 years they have added a bunch of dlcs but made nothing to complete story. Wait for another 5-10 years if they don't close studio.
I can't recommend it in current state.

As someone with several hundred hours in PD2 between console and PC, I would say PD3 is worth it when discounted. While I didnt play at launch, the game seems to be in a better state than it had initially was released in. This review is subject to change as I continue to play the game, however it reflects my mindset with my first 17 or so hours of the game 

Pros: 
-while a bit cumbersome, the skills trees have a good amount of depth to them. Granted I have not unlocked all the trees, but the foundation for a variety of builds is set
-stealth has massively improved IMO, with a greater variety of ways to complete heists, QOL features while in casing mode, new features such as the QR code system etc 
-gunplay feels good with a decent range of attachments
-overall gameplay loop is satisfying with new special enemies and heist designs 
-finally added beta single player 

Cons:
-while i personally dont mind the attachment/gun leveling system, I could see how others may not like being locked out of attachments based on weapon level. On the same note of guns, I wish there were more guns and more unique guns/weapons. Admittedly this can be solved with future content releases and updates, but rn the gun choice feels a little dry
-number of heists: Similar to the gun argument, this can be solved with future content releases and updates, but right now there is a relatively limited number of heists even with the DLC and update heists
-beta single player is present, but still requires online connection at the time of writing this

[h1]Game still sucks, but so does Starbreeze.[/h1] 
[h3]Or: "Please Don't Buy This Game; A Cautionary Tale"[/h3]

Payday 3, even after all these years, is still a very basic and mediocre shooter that completely dodges what made the other games in the series fun. The weapons are dull, the customization sucks ass, the characters (both new and old) are flat and have nothing to hold on to, the heists and enemies range from boring to annoying, the game is fucking online-only with DLC, etc.

And yet, for almost two years, I held out hope. I kept saying to myself, "It was the same with Payday 2! They'll fix it eventually!" However, their constant fumbling of both the game and their staff have proven to me that they are one of the most incompetent, arrogant, and stubborn game companies I have ever had the displeasure of giving my money to. From recent layoffs of the French team, to ignoring the suggestions and feedback of fans and content creators, to releasing the game in a completely unfinished state. They have proven, time and time again, that they are physically incapable of treating the game, their employees, their company, and their fans with the smallest amount of respect, being around so long because of blind, hopeful Payday fans like me who didn't know better and/or were in constant denial about the game and its future.

I was a massive fucking moron for thinking this game would ever be good. Hell, I fucking preordered it for a reward that became fucking DLC, because I can go fuck myself for supporting the game early, apparently. Everything about this game, before and after launch, was/is a red flag, and is a true reflection of Starbreeze as a company and game studio. Don't buy the game, don't buy the DLC; hell don't even play the fucking game (not that you'd want to.)
The game has big future in front of it if the dev's put away their greed and make a shit ton of content for it or atleast a few bigger free updates.

PAYDAY 3 emerges as a highly anticipated continuation of the beloved cooperative heist series, delivering an adrenaline-fueled blend of tactical gameplay, chaotic action, and cinematic flair that both honors its roots and pushes the franchise forward. Developed by Overkill Software and published by Starbreeze Studios, this latest installment takes place several years after PAYDAY 2, transporting players to the neon-lit streets of New York City, where criminal enterprises have evolved but the stakes remain as high as ever. From the moment you step into the shoes of a professional thief again, PAYDAY 3 captivates with its intense heist scenarios, diverse mission structures, and an emphasis on team coordination, making every job feel like a high-stakes movie sequence.

Rating: 7/10

At its core, PAYDAY 3 continues to build on the series’ signature cooperative gameplay, where up to four players collaborate to plan and execute a wide variety of heists ranging from bank robberies and jewelry store hits to high-profile cybercrime and black-market deals. The game encourages players to strategize, communicate, and adapt on the fly, blending stealth and aggression in ways that feel dynamic and rewarding. Unlike its predecessors, PAYDAY 3 introduces more verticality and expansive environments, allowing for creative approaches and diverse tactics. The AI enemies are smarter and more reactive, responding to player actions with tactical squad maneuvers, making stealth more challenging but equally satisfying when pulled off successfully.

The progression system has been revamped to offer deeper customization and personalization. Players can tailor their characters with a wider array of skills, weapon modifications, and cosmetic options, allowing for unique playstyles that suit both aggressive gunfire specialists and methodical stealth operatives. The loadout customization feels more granular than ever, with intricate weapon attachments and perks that impact gameplay in meaningful ways. This depth is complemented by an engaging narrative layer that explores the characters’ backstories and motivations, adding emotional weight to the otherwise high-octane action.

Visually, PAYDAY 3 represents a significant upgrade, boasting detailed character models, realistic lighting, and meticulously crafted urban environments that bring New York’s criminal underworld to life. The cityscape serves as more than just a backdrop—it’s a living, breathing world filled with pedestrians, traffic, and dynamic events that can either complicate or aid your plans. The sound design is equally impressive, with punchy weapon sounds, tense music cues, and crisp voice acting that heighten the sense of immersion and urgency during every heist.

One of the standout features of PAYDAY 3 is its commitment to replayability. Each heist offers multiple entry points, objectives, and exit strategies, and random events keep players on their toes. The procedural elements ensure no two runs feel identical, rewarding players who experiment with different tactics and teamwork. Furthermore, the developers have placed a strong emphasis on community and cooperative play, introducing matchmaking improvements and social features that facilitate smoother team building and communication.

Despite its many strengths, PAYDAY 3 is not without flaws. Some players have noted occasional bugs and performance hiccups, particularly in the early stages of launch, though ongoing patches suggest the developers are committed to addressing these issues. Additionally, while the progression system is deep, it may feel overwhelming to newcomers unfamiliar with the franchise’s mechanics. The narrative, while engaging, can sometimes take a backseat to the gameplay, leaving players craving a more cinematic or story-driven experience.

In summary, PAYDAY 3 successfully revitalizes the cooperative heist genre with a blend of polished gameplay mechanics, rich customization, and a vibrant open-world setting. It manages to balance the thrill of high-risk robberies with strategic planning and teamwork, creating moments of intense action and nail-biting stealth that keep players coming back for more. Though it has room to grow, especially in smoothing out technical issues and expanding its narrative depth, PAYDAY 3 stands as a worthy successor that both longtime fans and new players can appreciate, offering an exhilarating dive into the adrenaline-soaked world of modern heists.

I can finally recommend this game. It still isn't up to the level of Payday 2 but the potential is here and it's turned out to be a fun game. I'm just gonna talk about the stuff I like that is an improvement since Payday 2.

 Zip ties are no longer finite. You're carrying around a bottomless Costco bag of zip ties. This is something that annoyed me in Payday 2.

 Small Safes now have a unique lockpicking mechanic that is fun. The drill is no longer used for everything, it also doesn't take forever. Now smaller safes can be picked in a very satisfying minigame where you turn the dial until it goes green three times. It's pretty nice.

Lockpicking is actually a minigame now too. Gone are the days of just staring at an object and holding the pick button. Now there's a minigame that is actually faster than picking in Payday 2. Even messing up only penalizes you by not opening the lock sooner. Really nice change imo

Hostages are much easier to deal with. Ordering them around, using them as a human shields, booping them to the ground for a tie down. It's much easier and fluid than it was in Payday 2. Being able to grab them and throw them to the ground in a specific location beats trying to herd them in Payday 2.

New enemy types and improved favorites. New guys are grenade cops, hostage rescue is now a unique enemy, there's cops that hide and control drones to mess with you. The tazer cops are cooler, you can shoot their battery pack to shock a bunch of cops around them. The Dozer seems to have had the largest improvement and dealing with them is difficult and satisfying. You can also shoot antenas off of FBI vans to end waves at times too.

Side objectives can be found in many of the heists. Like finding specific loot in the safety deposit boxes or going the extra mile to make and employee use a biometric scanner at the jewelry store to get those last four high value items.

Now you can just choose your heist. No more waiting for the one you want to pop up or spending in game currency to buy the contracts. Just pick what you want to play.

Gun attachments are no longer an RNG gambling hell. Now you level up weapons by using them. As you level up, more parts become available to buy and install. This is a godsend.

Killstreak rewards. So now instead of starting with a grenade launcher or minigun as a primary weapon, they're now killstreak rewards you can call in during a mission. I like this option more because it doesn't tie up your primary slot.

The ECM Jammers are now tools and seperate from health/ammo deployments. That means you can have those along with health, ammo, armor, and a sentry. There are also new tools added like motion detectors, EMPs, and a few others.

The armor system is pretty cool. Now you choose a base frame that has different pros/cons. Lighter frames have less movement penalties but only hold one armor plate. Bigger frames hold more plates and ammo but has movement penalties. There's a few different plates to choose from too. Each with their own benefits and draw backs. It's really interesting to customize the armor. It also affects how many downs you are allotted as well.

 All in all, the game is pretty solid and they're about to release a rework of the skills. This game isn't better than Payday 2 or at its level yet. But the improvements I listed are enough QOL improvements for me to really enjoy what it is currently. If you can catch this game on sale, I wouldn't hesitate.

 One last thing. Payday 3 still supports playing DLC you don't own as long as the host has purchased it. This is a really nice feature I wish more games had. Doesn't lock your buddies out of playing new heists and you're not forced to play them with randos.

 There still is no offline mode, but they have added a solo mode that is currently in beta. The solo mode is to host your own games so you're not bogging down servers or something. Idk but it's there so I thought I'd mention it.

I can definitely understand the massive backlash from the community, but I also really like this game. Maybe just because I wasn't expecting Payday 2 2 ?
The stealth system feels very good (tho some missions are impossible in Stealth on higher difficulties and that's stupid.) and I really like the changes made to most enemies (only exception being the bulldozer having a very annoying stun). Furthermore, I really like what they did with the Overskill weapons ! Great burst damage that needs work to be "loaded" and that allows for a small time of pure fun.

Now for the bad part:
I do not like the new weapons system, nor do I like the new skills system. The weapons are unbearably grindy and the skills are all over the place; with none really being fully build defining. Unlike Payday 2, you can't really make a niche stupid but fun build like melee or dodge; although the new temporary bonuses do compliment your equipment pretty well. You get actively penalized by the skill tree for using a type of armor, even tho it's the only one similar to previous games.
Another pretty big criticism is the inconsistency of the performances. Massive lag spikes, frame drops and random blurry textures are a big issue in this game and I really hope they get fixed.

Overall, I'd say this game is a lot better than when it released; and I'm glad it decided to stray away from Payday 2. The game needed to stand on its own without just being the same as the previous one and I'd say it did this pretty well ! If you are looking for a better Payday 2, this is NOT the game for you. If you are looking for a completely different Payday experience ? I highly recommend giving this a try when it goes on sale.
(PS: The characters are pretty cool too, I especially like the new Jacket !)

Almost 2 years after launch, and I'm genuinely struggling to find any reason to recommend Payday 3 over Payday 2. Could be fun if you have a friend or two to play with, but that's the same with most games. At time of review its $9 and as the game is, I would still feel i didn't get my moneys worth. Other then the way the guns feel, the better gun play and the mask off activities, everything feels a step backwards. Still has server issues. Customization is still garbage. Yes, you now have more suit and glove options, but practically no guns compared to even the base Payday 2. Finally grind money for a new gun? Hope you weren't expecting to be able to put anything on it. Nope, its COD style weapon leveling for attachments. Now you've got hardly any incentive to try a new weapon without more grind. Game has alot more maps then when i put it down a week after launch, but server issues make it a hassle to even get a solo match going. After waiting for the game to boot, then load shaders, then finally log into a server for the main menu, I checked a loadout, and picked a, new to me, early mission to try out. Spent a several minutes loading for what was apparently an offline solo mission. Ended up just ALT+F4 the game. Loading times are still a joke. 4/10, game would be a solid 6/10 if not for the long load times and servers.

game has come along quite well since its poor launch. It has quite a bit less content compared to Payday 2, but that game has been out for a decade. Current (as of June 27, 2025) Payday 3 runs very smoothly on a 5 year old PC, even on Maximum settings, the servers run just fine, and even my buddy who has satelite internet can play with me. It is worth it as it stands, and will only get better. Keep up the wonderful work, and lets see Payday 3 become as successful as payday 2 in the years to come

Payday 3 was always going to struggle to steal the show with its predecessor boasting a decade of support but this was a particularly fantastic blunder. Recent updates show a hint of promise but the fundamental issue of the games reliance on servers buggered up its launch and spells certain doom for its future. 

Why am I searching for servers for my private lobby? Why does my game need to process painting a mask or buying a gun? Why am I being ushered through the pre-game setup, as if I have to get on with it and make room for the next group of heisters? Why am I lagging in my own sodding server? Leave me alone.

It's not a terrible foundation, really. But it will need time and effort to reach the level of content and depth of its systems Payday 2 has, the only question is: how many of us are willing to risk investing in this game until that point? After feeling robbed myself here, I don't think I am.
Halfway through 2025 and the core missions the game launched with still have game-breaking softlocking bugs. That tells you everything you need to know about the state of the game.

Buy it on sale and cross your fingers its still in service. None of the people from Payday 2 worked on this game, so we have a heaping pile of problems that didn't exist in Payday 2.

The only aspect I like about it is the Stealth improvements, Turret improvements, and concept of Overkill weapons. Otherwise, you're better off playing Payday 2 / Payday: The Heist.

As a huge PAYDAY 2 fan—it's honestly one of my all-time favorite games—PAYDAY 3 was a massive disappointment for me. I was genuinely excited, hoping for a worthy successor, but what we got felt like a completely different game in the worst way.

The gameplay lost the gritty, intense vibe that made PAYDAY 2 so addicting. And the graphics… they’ve gone with this weird, almost Fortnite-like aesthetic that completely kills the atmosphere. It doesn’t feel grounded or immersive anymore—it feels cartoony and soulless.

I really wanted to love PAYDAY 3, but it just doesn’t have the charm, depth, or style that made the second game so incredible. Honestly, it feels like a step backward in almost every way.

Before the Armor 2.0 update payday3 was decent - it wasnt super bad, just kinda easy, repetitive and a bit boring after some time,
But now after the update and the recent balance changes, payday3 finally is enjoyable and actually fun to play.
Armor 2.0 is much better than the old armor, providing more variety to builds.
They brought back the old payday2 armor (which they also balanced very well)
They finally added an option to have different outfits for different builds.
Stealth is (and was) much better than in payday2.
Loud, after the recent update, is finally great and somewhat challenging - snipers now actually shoot, naders throw their grenades (and actually throw them much better and more often than before), cops finally deal damage etc
The OG heists are great, the newer ones aren't much worse
And the newest Powder Party heist gives payday2s Shadow raid heist vibes, which in my opinion is great.
One thing - please add something like payday2s infamy system, it would really help the game and its progression
and maybe rework the shop so the primary weapons and secondaries are in separate categories
fun better challenging balanced the AI is better

I dropped this game shortly after launch, it was just that bad.
If you were coming from Payday 2, the state of Payday 3 was basically unacceptable, they had completely changed core mechanics and it was a struggle to understand why. The updates to stealth missions were interesting at least, but there were many other changes that were made that were just a struggle for people to understand. To follow that up, a surprising number of the heists want you to steal crypto currency instead of actual money, which is honestly kind of annoying; whats the point in a bank robbing simulator when you're grabbing a USB or QR Codes instead of fat sacks of cash?
HOWEVER. This game has received many updates, chief among them being the Armor 2.0; this lets you modify your armor so that if you wanted, you could play with the Payday 2 version of armor which is FANTASTIC. It should've been there from the start, but I suppose its better late than never. I've also heard about the possibility of skill revamps, which would be welcome. The game is starting to head into a salvagable zone, and I honestly think that after the next few updates (and hopefully content drops) that if they pushed a campaign to get word out about Payday 3 they'd probably see some good responses from the community.
After all is said and done, I think the game is in a much better place, is decent fun, and is (finally) worth your time.

The game has a harsh set of negetive reviews so lets break this down fully.

The game was incredibly buggy at launch, I didn't play it during that time so I'm just going to go with what most people were complaining about. Understandable but how does this hold up 2 years later? There is now a semlbence of a solo mode, though it does require internet access (for now). 

In PD3's current state, the positives;
- Armour 2.0 has siginficantly put alot of build crafting on the menu for loud and stealth playstyles alike.
- Casing mode stealth is incredibly fun over payday 2's stealth system.
- The Ai currently in the game is challenging enough to warrant difficulty, specifically overkill.
- Dynamic heists, some of the heists have a few varied instances, this should be inrcreased across the board.
- Overkill weapon skill trees.
- Concealment no longer dictating loadouts for stealth.
= At the core, its more evolved and updated Payday.

In PD3's current state, the negatives;
- Singleplayer requires internet.
- Skills 2.0 is confirmed but not yet released.
- The Corporate buggery that has plagued this game from the beginning.
- Content is in a very rough release schedule as there are currently ~20 developers. ;-;
= These can be fixed hopefully but lets keep cautious optimisim friends.

Silver linings
- A new CEO has recently been put in charge of Starbreeze.
- Skills 2.0 is near completion, and if its anything like Armour 2.0, it will be fantastic.
-  The monitization can be mitigated by varied sales.

What PD3 needs going forward;
- Heist Specific loot through long term triumphs or completions, such as Outfits, Weapon presets, etc. (There is one for Cook Off where you have to attain 19 pure bags, and you get a charm.)
- A hideout that we can dump cash into as a long term spending/conquest. For the hideout to also assist in different mechanics, such as maybe heist favours.
- Heist secrets like Overdrill in First World Bank, etc.
- Weapon Presets should be moddable (this is a small issue but they could add more weapon presets tied to heist achievements or conquests).
- More Content, I would like to see at least a 2-3 returning heists a year and 2-3 new heists per year.

Payday 3 is a solid step forward for the franchise. It modernizes the classic heisting gameplay while staying true to its roots. Compared to Payday 2, stealth is much smoother and more rewarding. Most heists are playable in both loud and stealth modes, giving you freedom of approach.

🔫 Gameplay
The gunplay feels like a mix of CS2, Warzone, and Payday 2—with spray control, crosshair placement, sound cue awareness, and counter-strafing all being important, especially in loud heists on higher difficulties.

If you're a fan of stealth, this game offers a big improvement over previous entries. Loud heists can get chaotic, but they're fun and intense when mastered.

🔥 DLC RECOMMENDATION
Syntax Error & Houston Breakout are great additions.

Highly recommend the Syntax Error Weapon Pack – the shotgun is worth it.

🎮 If You Like These Games, You’ll Probably Enjoy This:
Counter-Strike (CS:GO / CS2)

Modern Call of Duty titles

Payday 1 & 2

Titanfall

Other tactical shooters

🖥 Graphics
Fantastic visuals, even on mid-range PCs.

You can run High settings with a decent rig, but Medium for competitive play.

🧠 Audience
☐ Beginner
✅ Casual Gamer
✅ Regular Gamer
✅ Experienced/Expert

📊 Breakdown
🎧 Music: Good
☠ Difficulty: Easy to learn / Hard to master
🐛 Bugs: Few bugs, nothing game-breaking
📖 Story: Good (for a co-op FPS)
⚔ Gameplay: Fun, challenging, sometimes frustrating in a good way
⏱ Length: 10–20 hrs for story, 100+ hrs with replayability
💰 Price/Value: Wait for a sale + grab some DLCs

🧾 Final Verdict
If you like tactical shooters or cooperative gameplay, Payday 3 is worth playing—especially with friends. It’s a modern, polished follow-up that still has room to grow, but already delivers a great experience.

✅ Grab it on sale and you won’t regret it.

The Payday gang is back, and let me tell you, it’s like reuniting with old friends, except instead of catching up over coffee, you’re zip‑tying hostages and hauling bags of cash out the back door.

Stealth is way more fun this time around. You can actually walk around in civilian disguise, hack cameras, and feel like a criminal mastermind… until somebody sneezes on a guard and the whole building goes loud. And when it does go loud? Oh boy. The gunplay is punchy, the cops are aggressive, and every mission turns into a beautiful disaster of shouting, gunfire, and someone in your squad yelling, “I TOLD YOU TO BRING AMMO!”

Progression is a bit grindy (challenges instead of XP for missions), and the game launched with fewer heists than I’d like. But when you’re actually mid‑heist with three buddies, all hell breaking loose while the soundtrack pounds; you forget about the flaws and just embrace the chaos.

The dynamic objectives are a nice touch, too. One run might have the vault upstairs, another puts it in the basement. Keeps you on your toes, and keeps things from feeling too samey.

TL;DR: Payday 3 isn’t perfect, it’s a little light on content and has its quirks, but when it works, it’s an absolute blast. It’s the kind of game where you’ll laugh, panic, and maybe accidentally tase your friend instead of the cop. 8/10, would rob again.

Devoid of content and entirely reliant on you choosing to do the exact same thing over and over again. After you complete each of the few missions for the first time you're not given a reason to ever do them again. Very corporate and soulless feel with no risks or passion anywhere in its design, unlike Payday 2. The game is just extremely bland in every conceivable way. Extremely overpriced for how little is offered. A lot of basic content and features from the previous games just aren't here and the ones that did return in Payday 3 are all done in a worse way than they were originally executed. Enemies aren't actually difficult or challenging to defeat, they are instead just all bullet sponges. Progression system feels awful, its a boring slog beginning to end and mostly pointless. Gunplay doesn't feel punchy or satisfying, it just "is", hard to describe but its not great. Even after all the dlc and updates its had for all this time post launch its still not where it should have been at launch. This game needed another year or two, maybe even more, in the oven and several tech tests to get player feedback. If you're interested in the series or this kind of genre just stick with Payday 2. Infinitely better in every possible way AND cheaper.

They fixed most of the issues the game had at launch. There's a solo mode now (although it's much more demanding on your computer) and most of the heists are at least somewhat fun. Dare I say, Boys in Blue is pretty damn good. Alot of the voice acting is amazing as well, with the pager/radio response lines taking the cake as some of the funniest. Chains calling himself a werewolf gave me a good chuckle when I was playing the tutorial, and Clover calling Dallas captain america will always be funny. The game is a little lacking with free content, and there's a lot of power creep with the desert eagle effectively making most other sidearms useless, but otherwise the content and weapon drought isn't too bad, especially considering you can join other people who have the DLC heists, just like in Payday 2. I'd say it's not worth 30 bucks right now, but pick it up when it's on sale.

Despite the game's shortcomings since release, There's surprisingly a pretty good amount of genuinely good improvements from the transition from Payday 2 to 3 (and yes, I count the lack of the H3H3 heisters to be a blessing.) 

When I initially played the beta (or atleast, as much as I could've with the hardware I had at the time) it felt underwhelming. I won't deny that Payday 3 still needs more time, but after catching it on sale... I figured I'd give it a shot, and surprisingly the year I turned my interest away from Payday as a whole ended up making this game somewhat enjoyable. Janky, but quite enjoyable. 

While I miss Simon Viklund's music, Gustavo really was allowed to cook, and man am I here for it! 
For the time being, I give the game a 6/10. Some may view the game as a disappointment, but Payday 2 didn't exactly have a great track record for a long while after release, so I'm going to sit back and do what the Cook Off Soundtrack says to do: Let Them Cook.

Honestly, it could be a very solid game but it lacks content, for 41 $CAD, you get eleven heists and too few weapons and masks. If you want more? get the year 1 pass for another 41 $CAD. Like in all honesty, if you want engagement, you need to give players something to engage over. It genuinely saddens me that you had a great license, a solid basis for the game. And ruined it by the greed your series was built on accusing.  

In conclusion, you have a price issue. People buying your game are faced with few heists with low replayability since the maps almost do not change from one time to another. They are hungry for content and then told they need to spend the price of the game a second time for less content. I love the series and do recommend the game, but only, and I very much put weight on this, ONLY if it's on sale. The game is simply not worth it's price right now.

I looked forward to this game as I was a big fan of payday 2. Something that does better compared to previous title:
- You could now do a lot more when unmask, the stealth are much better with a lot more new mechanics, feels like a modern game title finally (I absolutely hate Payday 2 stealth system).
- Better player controller, movement system are improved, player could vault over stuff and sliding now.
- More animations when interacting.

Noticeable problems with this game even after a year:
- UI/UX design are still sub-bar, better than the absolutely atrocious beta, but still very bad in 2025. For example, this is the first ever FPS categorized weapon using bundles and bundles only, I don't know which genius came up with this idea.
- Gun play is awful, guns feels like peashooter, damage and accuracy is just too poor. The enemies feels extremely tanky for some reason, even in the lowest difficulty, an armored goon took 3 DMR headshots to kill, so the headshot doesn't feel rewarding at all. And good luck with spraying as well cuz the damage falloff is unreal even the enemies are just 10 meters away. The grenade launcher feels weaker than Payday 1, it does not hold the name as a "Overkill" weapon.
- Feedback is also awful, in Payday 1 the most satisfying & rewarding sound is the "clink" when headshotting and breaking enemies glass helmet, this kinda of juice is simply missing from this game.
- Weapon progression is too tedious and slow, and honestly, it was just there to milk game hours. Also the attachments unlocked barely make noticeable differences to the weapon anyway.

Game got potential, but I wonder if the developers ever gonna realize it. If anyone want a better product in the same genre, just go play Payday 2.

I played this at launch on xbox (through gamepass) and found the game lacking in content. Decided to give it a go again with all the year one dlc, and I'm disappointed to say the game still feels severely lacking. After a year there are only 16 heists total (4 of which are paid dlc). There is some good here, like a much better casing phase of the heists, better gun play, improved stealth, and a better weapon progression system, but outside of that almost everything feels like a step backwards. Solo mode is poorly implemented with no option to choose AI loadouts or perks like in PD2. Solo mode is important as, at the time of writing this, this game only has about 874 active players acording to steamDB. The perks themselves don't feel as impactful, the music is a step down and you can no longer choose the tracks you want. Enemy variety feels lacking, heists feel repetitive, and personally I'm not a fan of the new "final wave" mechanic. Basically at the end of a heist cops will spawn endlessly until you extract, it doesn't make it harder or more of a challenge it just makes getting your bags of loot out a pain. If you can grab it on sale (and convince some friends as well) its a fine way to kill a weekend, but you'll be able to see all this game has to offer within a few hours, even less if you don't grab the dlc. I loved Payday 2, and I hope this game gets to that level, but it's very very far from there right now.

There's potential for a solid game here, but they released it far too soon for it to be mostly functional, or even fun. In its current state, mechanics are boring/annoying, objectives are slogs, enemies are bland. The only positives I can give this game at this point in time is it looks generally nicer graphically, the music is pretty cool and the gunplay is certainly improved somewhat over its predecessor.

That being said, I must reiterate that the game was simply released too early with half-baked designs and mechanics that weren't quite there yet and may as a result die by next year, even with armor 2.0 releasing by the end of May. (everyone is just going to use impact plates anyway.)

Also I didn't appreciate the fact that they resold the trifecta lootbag 3 months after release, when it was supposedly a pre-order bonus which was a spit in the face to players like myself who supported Starbreeze for years. Given the lack of care or effort put into this title, and the decisions made by Starbreeze over the course of this game's development I highly suggest looking elsewhere if you want something worth your time.

I just want a game that's like the 1997 hit movie Heat. 

You want that? Alright. Here's Payday 3. Lets start off with a cast of characters. You get the OG cast of characters. But now they're a bit more loose, quirky, and less professionally dressed. Young people don't like properly fitted suits. There's also a wide variety of female characters to choose from who don't have much of an explanation, they don't dress or have masks that match the rest of the team. Bane is gone, he's been replaced by some brave and stunning woman who has Marvel dialogue that definitely won't annoy you at all. And the dialogue? The voice actors and voice acting director did an outstanding job making the characters feel totally disconnected from the action in game. It's as if they did not want to be there at all, sometimes even eating lunch while they read their lines.

Well, what about guns? There's a decent selection, a good one I'd say. Animations are pretty good. However the design choice to make them sound worse than the last game was puzzling. At least you can install mods to improve the gun sounds (and the music, which is also worse in this game). Combat is VERY bullet spongy. I honestly don't remember taking over half of my magazine to kill one person in the last game. This game would benefit from a higher time to kill and I'd accept taking more damage from enemies to balance things out. But kids nowadays love being able to run out of cover like it's Fortnite. 

BUT THE HEEEEEEEIIIIIISTS?! Lets see how they improved. The same basic layouts are there like in the last game. There aren't many large good open spots to have firefights. Too many tight corridors, which aren't bad, but just too many of them. Really FUN AND ENGAGING THINGS LIKE standing on a circle on the ground waiting 5 -10 seconds for a hack to complete. The audience is gonna love that. Having a firefight in the street to get to the van? Nah. Kids nowadays just wanna put their bags under the skylight and just teleport to a mission complete screen.

Heat is a slow burn of a movie, but it does a fantastic job of completely surprising the viewer and putting them right in the middle of a bank robbery that just feels so real. Blood pumping yelling, ear rattling gunfire through the city streets, the adrenaline of running cover to cover and utilizing suppressing fire to get across to a getaway. 

Payday 3 is like being those two losers who watched the 1995 movie Heat, and then thought they could be the exact same in real life. So in 1997 they went to a bank in west Hollywood and proceeded to have a shootout that was not as cinematic. It wasn't as action packed, or flashy, or adrenaline pumping. And I won't spoil the ending of the real life heist where they both died after failing miserably to get away. But lets imagine that you were a part of their team and you got away with them. You all look at each other and go: "Well. That was fine I guess. Wasn't really as cool as I expected".

This game should be so much cooler than it really plays and feels. First, I will say that in it's current state, it is in a similar state to early Payday 2. It still isn't as peak as it could be, but who knows if it will ever be. What I will say is for a 12$ ish game it is worth the price. So far I've been having a ball playing it for the first time after avoiding it after the lack luster release.

Pros:-
TUTORIALS!!! 4 of them that actually explain things well.
Maskless stealth is a fresh new take on stealth. The Guards escorting you out of a private area for the 100th time hasn't gotten old yet (it really beats failing 15 minutes in). 
New graphics feel good.
UI is clean.
Puzzle components feel a lot more interactive over Payday2.
Guns feel a lot less arcadey (con for others pro for me)
New Overskills and their perks are honestly a great addition to the game.
Randomised number codes makes levels not feel "solved".
New Perk trees mostly flow together nicely.
Map seeds stay similar ish on restarts.
Offline Solo play is a good addition.
Escape methods on loud are less annoying to deal with.

Con:
Friend lobbies can take a while to load. 
No P2P connections, meaning you have to join a Overkill server first.
Loading into the game for the first time to loud volume and being unable to change till you have loaded shaders, made an account and linked it to steam takes far too long.
Favours need a rework on how to obtain them.
Weapon Loadouts and other menus are weird sometimes you got back to menu on back , other times you go back to the place you wanted to be.
Secondary Weapons are not clearly marked

TLDR: 1. No offline mode still so if servers go you can't play   2. no replayability or variations to heists   3. no communication to community   4. its only a matter of time before support is cut.

     If you really want a payday game get payday 2... I recently decided to try Payday 3 again after the last time I played it last summer and have some thoughts. I have a very high end PC that doesn't lag or stutter on any other game but payday 3 has been horrible, the time it takes too even load into a heist is terrible and the stuttering when moving around and playing is horrendous. Out of all the games I've bought and played this is the biggest disappointment I've ever had (and i bought SSKTJ) from its broken and unplayable launch 1.6 years ago from the time of my review until now there has been very little added to incentive players to come back if they've played all the heists once. 

    The new heists add very little and aren't good enough to justify returning or buying the game, For being a "live service" game they are constantly delaying updates and not communicating with the community and very little active playerbase. (540 average players per day in the last month,,, SSKTJ has 136 and Payday 2 has 17,084) there was even a glitch on 99 boxes that leveled your weapons up extremely fast that lasted from at least OCTOBER 4th to NOVEMBER 2nd. Currently there has not been an update for about 70 days and still no news, with the latest update being a desperate cash grab to squeeze the remain players for a little more money. The only updates we know coming to the game at some point in the future is a armor rework along with conformation they worked on a heist or two that may or may not come.

     The replayability is non-existent due to no heist variation and no infamy system like Payday 2. If you are a new player the skill system is extremely confusing due to only giving the player 28 skill points and with how many skills there are most players end up having to look up (or end up using) certain skills that most of the players end up using and with most weapons are under-powered and useless or "broken" most players end up using the same builds weapons and skills with no real variations. 

     In its current state Payday 3 is not worth the original 60 plus dollars and not even worth the 30 dollars it currently is. Payday 3 currently has NO offline mode, meaning if.. no when the servers get shutdown you will not be able to play the game at all even though you have bought it. With the games support getting moved to another project (Project Baxter a dnd game) and content creators leaving the game it is only a matter of time before what little support the game has left will be cut and Payday 3 gets abandon.
the game is good fuck people who say its bad
Fun gameplay and great graphics.

I dont think that this game is bad, but it isn't all there either. If i had to recommend anything it would be to buy it on sale. 

The main issue i have with the game is that it lacks content in its current state. For the price you pay there ins't nearly enough heists to consider buying it at full price. Either way the few guys you have access to, the few heists you can do without buying a dlc, and the lack of customization makes it feel like you got baited into buying it at full price.

The mechanics of a good payday are there, and i certainly do enjoy playing it. With the new systems that exist it makes it feel like an actual heist that you have to be thoughtful about and be particular. 

HOWEVER, there are plenty of issues that need to be addressed. 

The stealth in this game does not feel like paydays stealth, the mechanics are there, but the days of stealth builds are gone. Perks have few meaning in this game, and thats especially true with stealth. 

The perk system is another thing that while has the payday look, is far gone and doesn't matter as much as it used too. Liked being a juggernaut in a full suit of armor like me? Well you cant, cause its gone, which felt weird as it was a staple of the payday style. 

I hope to see this game be improved into the payday  title it deserves, but i dont believe in its current state thatit deserves to be a payday title.
payday 3 certainly doesnt have the same charm as payday 2, but it IS a good and fun game

I loved payday 2 and still do to this day, was beyond excited to hear that payday 3 was revealed and I was there on gamepass when it launched. Then playing it for days on end and the sheer of disappointment it has compared to payday 2 is depressing. You would have thought that they learned from their mistakes when payday 2 first released & the flaws in that but they didnt, somehow someway they made it worse. Now that its been almost 2 full years since release of this game its still in a depressing state. There is beyond less content in almost if not every single way, they HAD to make a singleplayer mode (because it was not there on release, its still in "beta" btw), The bots are horrible (somehow worse than payday 2 bots), The game is beyond braindead easy and does not feel like a challenge.  Talents trees are a mess and are not fun nor engaging like the second game. There are no melee weapons (jackets DLC weapon does not count since its a overkill weapon) Like what the hell happened? Why did we go backwards in every way possible. 

Truly wish they didnt make payday 3 but instead just put Payday 2 into their new engine,  updated the gun play & movement in pday 2. Because pday 3 has really good gun play & movement thats all I can say good about this game. 

Please STAY away from payday 3 and instead put your time into payday 2, this game has nothing good to offer and is a embarrassment to this games history. I want this game to succeed and come back from the dead but the way things are looking on the outside and the inside of this company its most likely doomed for future support, let alone bringing in good content.

Just don't.. it's such a disappointment vs PD 2..

Offline mode? Disabled. Freedom? Revoked. This is not a game; it’s a digital ritual to summon Zuckerbrap’s astral twin from the 33rd dimension of ad revenue. My cat hasn’t blinked since I launched it. The servers are in Antarctica, guarded by glow in the dark CIA penguins.

They said “always online” but they meant “always observed.” The tutorial whispered my social security number backwards. My fridge now connects to the same server as the game. I don’t even HAVE Wi-Fi. The feds implanted routers into my drywall.

This game is a shadow of what payday 2 was. The skill system sucks by comparison. In the old payday 2 skill system there was a ton of versatility like you could make a build that healed itself when it picked up ammo which was good for medic classes, or you could get builds with awesome armor pen that could easily devastate shield dudes. Then being able to combine cards with the skill system took it to another level in PD2. Payday 3 said "screw the skill system stuff lets just use the cards as a sill system" and it honestly sucks. 

On top of that I feel like there should be ammo types that that arent deployables, in pd2 you could just have incendiary rounds where if this game gave you ammo types it would just make it a deployable. 

I got bored after about 50 hours. Aside from it launching with only like 10 missions I found most of the missions to be more stealth favoring. Although theyve added more loud levels since at least. 

I just think to bring this game up to the level of payday 2 they need to redesign the skill system entirely to be deeper and more versatile and have that be just like pay day 2 where it pairs with a card system that accentuates the builds in the skill system. Maybe add ammo types that are accessible via the weapons customization menu. but honestly it needs more than that and I cant being to start on every single thing that needs to be unwraveled to bring this game up to the level of pay day 2. 

I willl say the soundtrack is goated, that is a solid thing about the game, and I enjoy the personalities. The clothing selection could be a bit better.

In my opinion the biggest problems the game has are as follows:
-The armor system is not thought out and hinders the game's pacing
-A lot of heists lack replayability and good soundtracks for loud
-Mechanic's are not well explained nor does the game give you any numbers to work with
-There is a severe lack of unique heists, like a cool prison outbreak or train heist
-It beeing always online and requiring a third party account is another issue
-You can't customize your bots like in PD2 while also beeing too weak for overkill
-A lack of enemy variety and cloakers can be completely silent (darktide, is that you?)
-Weapon attachments and what they do make zero sense
-Severe lack in mask customization, and a moderate lack of customization overall
-Prestige, or infamy levels, mean nothing at all in this game
-The UI is the worst i have ever seen, even after the improvements

For positives, well i would say everything else you can think off is either pretty well designed or decent enough

Buy and play Payday 2 rather than this
It is a better game in every way you can think of

First things things first, how do you end up making a third game worse than the second? I've played a copy on Roblox and had more fun I'm not even kidding. Before launch I was absolutely stoked, I was quickly disappointed. Although at launch this game was considered horrible I gave it a long time to make the necessary changes before even buying it. So when I seen it was on sale I bought it and played the tutorial just to stop playing for a long time. Although months later I decided to actually play it.

Despite only having 15-16 hours on the game which isn't anything crazy it's safe to say that I much more enjoy the second game. I'm sure there are people out there who disagree but the overall difference to me personally is clear. Not only is the second game more simple in terms of the mission pool that scales to harder levels with this one also having that but I feel that they don't have it the same way. In Payday 2 I often found myself revisiting older and more simple missions to do them stealth to learn how to play the game that way and I much more enjoyed it. With Payday 3 this play style was overhauled and although it isn't bad, it simply isn't for me. The missions aren't ones that feel like coming back to. They are extremely repetitive, with Payday 2 I often did the same missions <50 times and still had fun because it felt like anything could happen throughout said missions. 

Payday 3 seemed to try to jump the "realistic" train, that others games are seen to also do. We can see it in games such as COD, but that's not a bad idea, personally I think it's great however there's a line in that path between "too realistic" and "playability." It depends on who you are talking to. Games such as Tarkov, and especially DayZ really push this realistic idea to its extremes which some people like. However I personally don't care for the realistic aspect. Obviously I want mechanics to make sense in our world and I do understand they don't want guards to be fucking blind as shit like they are in Payday 2, but certain mechanics like that are fine in my eyes because they make the game more enjoyable. In Payday 2 it feels amazing zipping past 3 guards just to barely fill the meter. Although not realistic, it makes for a much more enjoyable gameplay experience. 

My best hope is that this game can improve on their current mechanics, for now I'll still play Payday 2. I'll return in a year or so to see how its doing but for now I'm out.

I picked the game and the year 1 pass up on sale for about $20, and for that price it’s not too bad. I’ve had some fun, mostly with the improved stealth mechanics. 

Despite this Payday 2 is still better in every other way.

- Progression is boring (very grindy) and doesn’t offer enough base game weapons both normal/overkill and attachements

- Enemies are bullet sponges and weapon balance feels jacked up. (this is why I don’t play this to do anything but sneak around)

The game and DLC is just not worth full price, but at the state that the game is currently in it feels like they’d have to overhaul the entire progression system and weapon balance in order to make it worth it not on sale and I’m starting to believe that ship has already sailed. So just wait for a sale.

We all know that the launch was a little bit of a Cyberpunk 2077 incident but we are past that now. Let me say that I DO recommend this game if it is on sale for now, or maybe in the future once it is better I'll recommend it at its current price. I loved Payday 2 and still do, and this game truly doesn't disappoint me as much as I feel the greater part of the internet has pushed it down. Please don't be stuck in the past and still be under the impression that this game is still the train wreck it we know it was at the time of launch. Now it's more like the train at least hit the brakes before wiping out. Anyway, I will say something I'm not the biggest fan of regarding this game is the fact that there are things that I don't believe should cost money. Now I understand that they are trying to keep up with the server cost and such but still. I do believe that if this game is on sale (as it is quite a lot) and you enjoyed Payday 2, you should give this game a try. Hey, you can always return it if it ends up being that bad in your eyes, but not in mine. This game still can make builds for your loud and quiet set or anything in between. I do say that I truly enjoy the heists in this game, some more than others but regardless I do. I hope they continue to work hard in the future to both fix and update this game. I must say that it looks leagues better than at launch. I am proud of the work they have done to fix their game, so thank you.

Payday 3 looks incredibly well and isn't as bad as everyone says it is, but is lacking content and includes numerous bugs that should have been patched a long time ago. (cook off van randomly frozen ending the heist in a failure, first world bank elevator with termite not opening etc.)

Loud is way too easy if you are a high level and know what you're doing. There needs to be an increased difficulty option, just like one down in Payday 2.

Stealth is also ridiculously hard on overkill compared to Payday 2 where you could just breeze through maps on Death sentence, one down.

I still like the game, but i am hoping that the bugs get fixed and new content with more maps come out soon.

TLDR; Don't buy this game, it has no future and it is looking even grimmer for the game, the updates they do make add nothing of substance and the cancellation of the offline mode echoes SBZ' selective deafness to its core audience. Like owning the game you bought? Not here you don't...

Here we go...

As much as I want PAYDAY 3 to succeed it just has too many problems plaguing it both from a gameplay standpoint and a business standpoint. 

Gameplay wise the balance and execution is all over the place whether it be the weapons, the skills, the enemies, the C-stacks system (clearly meant to have been a form of micro-transactions) or the UI (which is still stuck in its alpha stage). 

We still don't have a proper offline mode years after release and the worst thing is that server costs are killing this game even though the servers are absolute rubbish, you can't even buy items without having to wait a few seconds for the game to communicate to the server, also to mention is the constant downtime after every update due to the servers being either overloaded or needing maintenance. 

To top it off the DLCs are just getting worse in terms of content and they are becoming more predatory. You can barely play half the game without paying for DLCs unless you know someone who has them but even then you can't access the weaponry which is all way too powerful compared to base game. I'll admit the free heists are nice but they mostly just consist of rehashes of old content that try to appease to nostalgia hungry fans that want to remember a better time of when PAYDAY was the king of co-op shooters.

There is also the constant content droughts and with the little content we do get being the overpriced DLCs that shy in comparison to their PAYDAY 2 counterparts (looking at you Jacket) especially with what they include.

PAYDAY 2 - Hotline Miami DLC - 1 new heist, 1 new character, 8 new weapons, 8 new masks, 8 new patterns, 8 new materials and 7 achievements.

PAYDAY 3 - Jacket Character Pack DLC - 1 new character, 1 new mask, a reskin of a already existing weapon, 1 overskill weapon, 1 charm and a sticker...

It really feels bad coming back to PAYDAY 3 since I've almost leveled up every gun in the game and overskill and I just don't know what else there will be once I finish, a DLC will probably drop and we won't see another piece of content for PAYDAY 3 for the next few months. Rinse and repeat until the game dies from it's publisher's own stupidity.

Speaking of, the CEOs at Starbreeze don't seem to even want PAYDAY 3 as a game to strive but rather want the PAYDAY franchise to be used as nothing more than a tool of recognition to sell off to any company wanting to make a quick buck with crossovers. Starbreeze have turned long term fans away in favor for a quick buck and they act like everything is okay while the real devs at Overkill beg for us to buy their DLC and play their underfunded mess of a game. 

I honestly think a lot of the dying fanbase of PAYDAY 3 will either return to PAYDAY 2 or leave to play Den of Wolves which is looking pretty promising at the moment. Which pains me to say because with some good TLC I know for a fact that PAYDAY 3 can become even better than PAYDAY 2, they are just going about it extremely wrong.

Starbreeze and Overkill need to face the fact that they are no longer the kings of co-op heisting games anymore and they are going to have to do more than release a small content patch every half year along with overpriced DLC and promises of doing better to keep interest high and fans around but even then I'll still go play something by another studio/publisher that deserves my money, especially after the active lay offs happening at the moment with whole teams being shut down... Shame on you Starbreeze.

It's really not as bad as everyone says. The core gameplay, both in loud and stealth is very fun. Cops are a little smarter than the first game, stealth is more immersive and has many more mechanics. They really learned their lesson from the post-White House heists in making both stealth and loud gameplay more interesting. Of course there are still a couple heists that are just "Wait for drill, shoot cops, fix drill, wait for drill some more, shoot cops, get cash, shoot cops, get out" (First World Bank my beloved) but a lot of heists, especially in stealth, are much more engaging. Outside of the main gameplay loop, unlocking new things doesn't take long and you have time to try everything. Only problem I have is unlocking attachments, it takes way too long and you have to do it for each weapon separately. Every armor except adaptive is useless because it's much easier to lose, as it doesn't regenerate fully but that's getting worked on so this will be outdated soon. 
Some specials I have a problem with. Snipers in Payday 2 were too harsh, they shot you in like 1-2 seconds but these ones are just pathetic, you can reload you weapon right in front of them, take your time aiming and they still won't fire unless you're just REALLY slow. Imo, they should have different aiming speeds based on difficulty, because the current one is befitting of Normal difficulty, not the Very Hard that I usually play on. Cloakers are annoying because they no longer need line of sight to start running at you so sometimes you just turn a corner and surprise, you get knocked down. Bulldozers are wayy too tanky, like they are so hard to take down, it's rather annoying. Tazers, or Zappers as  they're called now almost never actually taze you, they just take their sweet time pulling out the tazer and getting shot. Naders are my favorite though, they can be blown up easily if you shoot them first but if you can't they will deny an area very effectively. Shields no longer limit your loadout by requiring you to bring something that will penetrate their shield, instead you can just shoot the faceplate. Also cops like to hide behind them which is pretty neat. Techies are alright, I like the hide n seek aspect and the drones feel balanced.
Really, the game is not that awful. It's still rough around the edges but with a little more development in the right direction they can still turn this ship around.
This game is good, I don't know why people are hating on it.

In my opinion, it's better than payday 2. The gunplay feels amazing, sure you could argue that there isn't a great variety of enemies but it's still very fun.

Overall just a bad user experience. First off, you need to create an account and sign in before you even have access to any menus. If you're playing online co-op and restart a heist it has a tendency to disconnect everyone and you have to re-join the lobby to start the mission over again. Also, the mission briefings are only available when you launch into a mission and disappear once the game is loaded, so unless you're a speed reader you'll have a hard time figuring out what the objective is.

The actual game play is pretty reminiscent of PayDay 2, but the missions themselves feel nearly identical to the ones from the previous game (e.g. jewelry store, night club). The game just lacks any sort of imagination or self-identity, it's just straight disrespectful to those that logged so many hours into its predecessor. I bought the game on sale, and it still feels like I overpaid for this game.

I am a 46 year old single father, probably one of the oldest people still playing this game. My son, who is 15 now, begged me to get GTA San Andreas because he said it was one of the best games ever made for its open world and story. I got it for him, thinking it would be something fun we could enjoy together.

For weeks, I watched him get lost in the streets of Los Santos, flying through missions and enjoying the chaos of the game. He would drive fast, get into shootouts, and laugh when things went wrong, while I sat there feeling clueless. I did not understand the controls or the pace. I was just the dad sitting in the background.

One night, after he went to bed, I picked up the controller. The city felt alive but also lonely. I drove slowly, crashed often, and failed more than once. Then something clicked. The controls started to make sense. The missions felt rewarding. Hours passed before I realized how late it was. I had made real progress and actually felt proud of it.

The next day, I showed my son what I had done. He did not say much, but I could tell something had changed. He no longer looked at me as the dad who did not understand games. He saw me as someone who had taken on the same challenges he had. We sat together, played together, and for the first time in a long while, we were not just father and son. We were playing the same world side by side.

Thank you, GTA San Andreas, for giving me back something I thought I had lost.

GTA San Andreas has been with me since kindergarten and if I had a playtime tracker back then it would probably show 5-6k hours by now. It is one of my favourite games ever, easily in my top 5, maybe even top 3. I even remember once letting my dad try it, he got into a car and started stopping at every pedestrian crossing and patiently waited for the green light at traffic lights, which still makes me laugh when I think about it. I am not really a fan of this Definitive Edition, I think with mods the original game could look and play much better, but it was still fun to see all the old bugs and mechanics again. I bought it here and immediately tried to speedrun it because I watched a lot of Hugo One streams, he beats it in about 4 hours, my first run took around 20. Still, it was a cool experience and if I decide to speedrun it again I am sure it will be faster. Whatever you think about this version, San Andreas is a game for the ages.
Thank you, CJ and SAMP, for the memories

Nostalgic but Honest" (Balanced)

Headline: Still the best story, even if the coat of paint is a bit messy.

Look, we all know the original San Andreas is a masterpiece. This version is the easiest way to play it on modern hardware without spending hours modding it, but it’s definitely not perfect.

The Good: The controls are much better—they finally added a "weapon wheel" and modernized the aiming so it feels more like GTA V. The lighting at sunset looks genuinely great, and having GPS on the mini-map is a lifesaver.

The Bad: Some of the character models still look a bit "off" (almost like clay figures), and they took out some of the iconic fog that made the map feel bigger. There are still occasional bugs, though most of the game-breaking ones from launch are gone.

Verdict: Buy it on sale. It’s still CJ, it’s still Grove Street, and the radio stations still slap. Just don't expect a full remake.
